Your eyes widen as you see your pet otter slinking around, clearly trying to avoid being heard by Luna. You assume that she's been following Luna for a while, potentially with intent to scare her. The otter is one of your pets, despite being a very uncommon type of pet. You only have her because you got her as a baby from a scientist wanting to study how an otter could be raised in captivity, but your attempts to raise her well must have failed. She often disobeys you and is very troublesome. This is why you think she'd been following Luna--she probably had some mischief planned. Unfortunately for you, that mischief might now be directed at you, because she's obviously spotted you.

You stand still, staring at her, and worry that she's going to act aggressive. The otter hurries over to you, stopping just short of running you over. She towers over you, and you gulp in fear. You try to remain brave, and open your mouth to speak and give her an order to not attack you, but before you can speak, the otter's head lowers down towards you, making you fall silent out of fear that she might eat you. Luckily, she simply begins to sniff you. You remain still, and wait until she's done. She rears her head back, cocking it to the side, and you question what she's about to do...
111122211111.title: Luna leaves, and the otter comes

1111222111111.content: The otter quickly lowers her head, jaws parting and biting down on the tiny creature standing just in front and under her. She manipulates her catch with her mouth, getting the taste for a bit before deciding to start chewing...
1111222111111.title: Bad end

choices: It ends better than expected, though
1111222111112.content:
Her left paw twitches a bit, and you glance at it before looking back up at her dark eyes. You seem to notice a glint of playfulness in them, then see her paw reach out to you. You're too scared to move, and you can only stare at the paw and think about what's about to happen. You've (obviously) never been picked up by a giant animal before, and the thought of what that might be like both interests and scares you.

The otter's paw reaches you, pushing you back slightly with the palm as the finger curl around your torso, pinning your arms to your sides. It feels surprisingly soft being held in her fist, mainly due to the pads on her palm and fingers, and she seems to not be holding you too tightly, which you like. Even so, you dislike your current position, as you're lifted off the ground and raised up towards the otter's (admittedly very cute) face. Even so, you can't feel that it's cute when it's bigger than you, and belongs to an animal that might hurt you. After all, she has you in her fist, which is probably the worst place for you to be. She has total control over you, and unlike the raccoon, never really did seem to like you that much. And seeing as the raccoon already jumped on and pinned you, seeming to act aggressively, you worry about what the otter might do to you...

She stares at you intently, and you don't bother to squirm--it would be useless to resist the otter, especially when she already has you in her grasp. She seems to know this, as she begins squeezing you over and over, either out of playfulness or to test how squishy you are, enjoying her power over you. She even slips her tongue out from her lips and licks your face, making you splutter and futilely try to wipe it off on the furry fist holding you.

After doing so and looking back up, you realize to your surprise that the otter is looking away form you, at something past you. You can't see it, but you can hear what sounds like a dog's pawsteps approaching. It's probably Luna, and you're worried now--there's two animals in the same room that don't like you very much, and both are giant. Plus, one of them already has you held tightly in her fist. You have a feeling this won't end well.
1111222111112.title: Her paw shoots forward to grab you!

choices: She is! Seems like "little" Ellie is a gentle giantess after all!
11112221111121.content:
You suddenly hear quiet footsteps (or at least, what seems like that). The otter seems afraid suddenly, and drops you to turn and run. You look over and see that, as you expected, Luna did return, but is now running too. You're left in the middle of the hallway, terrified about what made both of them run.

You get your answer when your elephant calf, Ellie, comes around the corner.

Definitely one of your most exotic pets, you got her from some zookeepers desiring someone to take care of her in a house for a few weeks. She's been a little mischievous, and loves using her trunk. This scares you right now. Considering you're now the perfect size to be plucked in her proboscis, you're worried about what she could do to you after finding you so small.

Unfortunately, Ellie seems to quickly spot you. The enormous grey-skinned mammal, ironically smaller than average at less than three feet tall, stops walking and stares right at you. With a trumpet, she hurries forward unto she's looming over you. You're frozen with fear as you stare up into the black eyes of the largest land mamal on earth--even larger at your size. It's worth noting that Ellie doesn't have any tusks, but that does nothing to help her frightening image at her size. You stand still, not even able to speak and tell her who you are. You just hope she recognizes you.

You're apparently too far below her eyes for her to get a good look, though, because she decides to bring you up closer. Ellie's trunk moves towards you, pressing against your left side and coiling around your torso and waist. You remain still, just taking in the sensation. This is something that anyone can experience--being picked up by elephants is a tourist attraction, after all--but at your size, it still feels much different.

Suddenly, the elephant calf's trunk tightens its grip, and you're quickly plucked off the ground. Your legs dangle, and your arms are pinned to your sides, but you don't bother to squirm as the gigantic animal lifts you up to her face, bringing you to one side so she can get a close look at you. You stare back into the eye, bigger than your head, and hope Ellie will be gentle with you...
11112221111121.title: The elephant comes

11112221111122.content: The otter doesn't waste any time. Even faster than anyone else might have thought, she quickly stuffs her catch into her mouth, chewing and swallowing so that the dog won't be able to steal her snack from her.
11112221111122.title: Bad end

choices: Very bad, as she starts playing with you in her mouth like a toy (or food)
Not so bad, as she doesn't seem interested in playing with or eating you
111122211112.content:
You get to your feet, and see the enormous form of your Yellow Lab, Star, approaching you. Her eyes are staring right at you, and you know she's spotted you. You gulp at the immense size difference between you and her, but you know that Star is a very gentle dog. You hope that she's retained her gentle nature despite the fact that you're now like a tiny bit of food to her.

The dog walks right over to you, looming over you with her forepaws on either side of you. You glance between them, noting their huge scale, and gather your courage before looking up at Star. She's staring right down at you, and you struggle to speak due to fear. Nonetheless, you manage to meekly call her name, and to your surprise, you notice her ears perk slightly. She lowers her head down until it's very close to you, and begins carefully sniffing you. You stand still, trying not to startle her, and she stops after a few moments. She rears her head back slightly, before cocking it to one side. It seems like she recognizes your smell. Or at least, she's interested by it.

Perhaps a bit too interested, because she quickly lowers her head again and parts her jaws. You're too scared by that to react, and just stand still as her tongue slips out of her mouth, scoops you up, and pulls you into her maw.

Her jaws close behind you, and you're trapped inside. At your current size, you easily fit inside her mouth, and you're in complete darkness lying on her tongue and soaking in drool. You still are too scared to move, even though you know this is a very bad position to be in. The question is, just how bad is it?
111122211112.title: Food for Star?

1111222111121.content: The dog moves her catch around with her tongue, tasting it closely. It seems to be moving around, almost as if it is struggling, but she barely feels it. She doesn't recognize its taste, but decides it seems like it might make a good enough snack. She swallows without a second thought...
1111222111121.title: Bad end

choices: Run away (and hope she doesn't catch you)
1111222111122.content:
You lie on your dog's tongue for a bit, and she slowly moves you around inside her maw. You're frozen in fear, and allow her to manipulate you. She doesn't seem to be doing much, though, simply pushing you around and trying to get your taste, it seems. Luckily, it ends soon, and Star opens her mouth and lets you drop out. You land on the ground, but don't feel too much pain. You try your best to wipe the drool from your eyes and look up at Star, looming over you and staring at you intently. Apparently, she recognized your taste and decided you aren't food. Which is good.

The question is, what now? Do you stay with her, or run and try to find another animal to help you get back to normal? Star seems nice, but she did stuff you in her maw...
1111222111122.title: Not eaten

11112221111221.content:
You can't just run away. Your dog hasn't killed you yet, and despite the way that she almost ate you, you feel like she's really on your side. Besides, she is the only friendly creature around, and you could use an ally right now.

So you stand up tall and look into the enormous brown eyes of the Yellow Lab. Her head rests on the ground right in front of you, and you can feel her breath flow over you from her nose. You step forward and carefully pat her on the nose as a sign of friendliness.

Star seems to like this, as her jaws part slightly and she sticks put her big tongue again. But this time, she just licks you, and does not pull you into her mouth. You smile at her. She really is on your side.

But the question is, now what? Should you try to travel with Star through your house and look for some way to undo your shrinking, or should you stay put and think before setting off?
11112221111221.title: Stay with Star

choices: Star understood your command and is going to the laboratory
This isn't the way to the lab! Where is Star going?
111122211112211.content:
You sigh and shake your head. You can’t delay any longer. It’s time to get going.

You wonder if there is any way to undo this shrinking. After thinking for a bit, you have an idea. You recall that you recently experimented with some chemicals to try making a mixture that could shrink living things. Clearly, that must be the reason why you shrunk. You’re surprised you didn’t remember it sooner, but you suppose it slipped your mind due to the stress and fear of being suddenly tiny in a house full of animals. In any case, it’s safe to assume that you will be able to undo your shrinking if you can get back to the laboratory and make a new mixture.

However, the laboratory is on the other side of the house, and it would take a long time to walk there at your current size. Plus, along the way, you could be attacked by any one of your many pets, each of whom is now massive compared to you. You need fast transportation, and also protection.

Luckily, Star can provide both.

You back away, partially to get away from the huge dog’s mouth, but also to get a better look into her eyes. She meets your gaze as you cup your hands to your mouth and shout, “Good girl! Thanks for not eating me.”

Star’s ears tilt a bit, and she starts wagging her tail and panting. Her hot breath blows over you, but you experienced worse when you were inside her mouth, so it doesn’t bother you.

You tell your dog, “Stay. Stay! I have an idea, but you have to stay put. Don’t move, alright?”

You go around the side of the Yellow Lab. She follows you with her gaze, but stays put. You repeat “Good girl!” a few times to reward her for her obedience and good behavior. You feel a bit surprised that she’s following your orders, considering how you’re so much smaller and weaker than her right now, but she always was quite obedient, and remarkably intelligent too. It seems like she still understands that you’re her master, and so she’s willing to listen to your orders, no matter how small you are.

The Yellow Lab doesn’t move at all as you go to her left foreleg and begin to climb up to her back. It feels weird to climb a furry, living wall like this, but you manage to make progress. Although you lose your grip once or twice, you recover and finally get to the top.

There, on the withers of the giant dog, you lie down and sigh, taking a quick breather for a few seconds before sitting up.

“Very good girl!” you shout, petting her shoulder. “Now, go to the lab, okay? The laboratory!”

You’ve brought Star to your lab a few times, and you’ve found that she seems to associate the words “laboratory” and “lab” with that location. So you trust she’ll know where to go.

She stands up and begins to walk. You try to hang on to the giant dog as she moves, shaking you around with each step. You can’t see past Star’s head in front of you, but you can look to the sides and see the scenery of your home’s interior quickly passing by. You take a moment to appreciate how lucky you are to have a friendly animal to help you get around more easily.

As you continue riding, you start to notice something…
111122211112211.title: Get going immediately

11112221111222.content:
You can't just stay here. Your dog hasn't killed you yet, but the way that she almost ate you still scares you, and you feel like she might very well not be on your side. So you do what any potential prey would do: you turn and flee.

And Star does what any predator would do: give chase. But as she reaches with a paw to pin the tiny creature, she underestimates its resilience, and she pushes way too hard. The creature doesn't move anymore after that.
11112221111222.title: Bad end

11112221112.content: You have way too many animals in your house. What can you say--you love raising them and helping them, and every one of your pets, even the very exotic ones, are here because they needed someone to raise them and you offered to do so. That means that it's difficult to pinpoint which of them is now approaching you, though. You rule out anything with clawed paws, so no dogs or cats, and nothing too small like a rat. You think about what animals can possibly be free to roam your house, and combined with the sound that the steps are making, you finally realize that the creature must be one of the more strange pets you keep...
11112221112.title: What is that?

111122211121.content:
To your surprise, you see a ring tailed lemur with a rather shanty-looking bandeau and skirt made from brown fabric come around the corner. She is Plio, a female lemur you got due to your skill with raising exotic animals. The clothes were partially due to your desire to not see the exposed privates and chest of a female primate, but also because they looked rather cute on her.

The lemur stopped when wishes entered the room, having spotted you and the raccoon. Plio had always been a troublemaker, and didn't get along with the other animals in your house completely. So, it was no surprise that the raccoon backed off, not wanting anything to do with Plio. She simply growled and backed off, giving you up to the lemur to do with you as she pleased.

The lemur hurries forward as the raccoon backs off, and you stare at her as she approaches, knowing that fleeing would be pointless. Plio reaches you quickly, and stands on all fours within arms reach at her size to you. You look at her, and she returns your gaze, trying to figure out what you are. You decide to speak up like before, and mention your name and hers repeatedly, hoping to make her recognize you. It's unclear if it works, though, because her next action could be interpreted either way.

Plio takes a small step forward, then reaches toward you with her left hand. Like the raccoon's, and like a human's, it has four fingers and a thumb, and it fully capable of grabbing you like a little doll. And that's exactly what Plio does. Her palm pushes you back as her fingers curl around you, closing into a tight fist. She holds it for a moment, seeming to be judging how it feels, then lifts you off the ground.

You don't struggle. It would be useless after all. Besides, you're too stunned by this to do much of anything. You've just been snatched up by a giant hand. That's certainly an experience you never thought you'd have. Seeing a giant animal is one thing--they exist in real life, after all, as whales and elephants and the like. Seeing your raccoon and lemur as giants wasn't too surprising, due to that. But the sensation of being picked up... That was something else.

Plio grasps you tightly, but you don't feel any pain or even discomfort. Her hand is fleshy like a human's, and soft, encasing your whole body. You'd never felt anything like it. It terrifies you, because you were totally under her control now, incapable of moving except if she moved you herself. But at the same time, the feeling of the hand and fingers around your body felt secure and safe, and the body heat and general softness especially made it feel very comfortable. In any other instance, this would be an enjoyable experience. Unfortunately, you are now being raised up to the lemur's face, and her grip retains its tightness, and you fear she'll turn hostile. There was nothing you could do to stop her, after all.

Plio stares intently at you, and you stare back. She doesn't show any sign of releasing you from her fist. Instead, she continues looking at you, then turns around and begins walking out of the room. You have no idea where she's taking you, or what she has planned, or if she's even friendly--she hasn't hurt you, but could at any time. So, you do the only thing you can: try to relax and let her carry you along, but with the thought that you need to fight back if she turns hostile. You won't be able to do much... But you need to fight, you need to resist.
111122211121.title: Plio's grasp

1111222112.content:
Suddenly, you hear loud barking. It must be one of your two dogs, Luna the husky and Star the Yellow Lab. Hearing their barking gives you some hope. Luna is mischievous while Star is gentle, and you're sure that both of them would try to get rid of the raccoon--Luna, admittedly, would probably only do so in order to play with you herself, while Star would most likely help you because you're her master and she wants to help you out of respect. Though Star would be better to encounter now, you admit that either would be preferable to the raccoon, who clearly does not think of you as her master anymore.

You hear the dog approaching. You don't know exactly what made her bark, but you guess you might find out later. Assuming you live through this, of course. The dog comes around the corner, and you see that it is...
1111222112.title: You hear barking from one of your dogs

choices: She's just following the raccoon, and doesn't see you
11112221121.content:
Luna, your husky, walks around the corner and stops as she spots the raccoon. Since you're so tiny, and most of your body is covered by the raccoon's paws, you assume that Luna hasn't seen you. However, she lowers her stance and growls at the raccoon, clearly not liking her for some reason. Luna, being a mischievous dog, doesn't get along so nicely with your other pets, and you're not surprised that she's showing some aggression towards the raccoon. Still, you don't think she's really aggressive--most likely, just planning to chase the raccoon around in order to play.

Either way, the raccoon doesn't want anything to do with that, so she lifts her hands off of you and turns, running away. You look at her as she runs, and feel the ground very slightly shake as Luna steps towards you. You look over at her as she walks in your direction, but you're not sure if she's seen you or if she's just following the raccoon...
11112221121.title: Luna finds the raccoon

111122211211.content: The Husky walks over to the tiny thing that the raccoon left behind, and sniffs at it. It only smells like the raccoon, though, and she can't figure out what exactly it is. Nonetheless, she decides it seems like food, and despite noticing that it seems to be moving and making a little noise, she scoops it up in her jaws and quickly eats it without a second thought...
111122211211.title: Bad end

choices: One of the more common pets: dog or horse
One of the more rare pets: otter, lemur, or raccoon
111122211212.content:
Luna barks, and hurries after her, just barely avoiding stepping on you. You watch as the enormous dog passes over you and leaves the room after the raccoon, and you're left there alone. It looks like she didn't see you there, being so tiny now, and just wanted to chase the raccoon for fun.

Finally out of danger for the time being, you decide to stand up and look around for a good hiding place. Clearly, your pets are up and about by this time, and you're bound to encounter some more throughout the day. So, in order to avoid any of them spotting you and attacking, you run in the opposite direction that Luna and the raccoon went, hoping to find a good hiding spot. As you run, you start thinking about all the animals you have in this house, and which of them might be the most helpful to find at your size--and which ones you should be sure to avoid.

Through a series of complicated events, you've gotten your hands on many common and rare animals to take care of, and so you've got quite a zoo of pets in your home. Besides Luna, Star, and the raccoon, you also own an otter, a lemur, and a horse foal. Besides them, you have some animals you've only recently obtained, and you have trouble keeping them straight. For now, you can only remember a few, but none of them are particularly appealing as potential friends.

You have a choice to make about which animal you trust most...
111122211212.title: Which pet do you trust?

1111222112121.content:
You could go looking for Luna, who just passed by, even though you're not too sure she'd be gentle with you. Alternatively, you could look for your Yellow Lab, Star, or seek your horse foal. Both of them are relatively gentle, and might be able to help you.

Who do you choose to look for?
1111222112121.title: One of the more common pets: dog or horse

11112221121211.content: You have two dogs to choose from. Do you choose the gentle Star or the mischievous Luna?
11112221121211.title: Choose one of the dogs

1111222112122.content: You decide to look for one of the less common pets you own. Among them are the raccoon (who just ran off, so she might be difficult to find), the otter, and the lemur, Plio. There are also other choices you could pick from, but you'll need to think about them some more--they don't come to mind as quickly, being newer than the others. Nonetheless, they're still options, assuming you can remember them soon.
1111222112122.title: One of the more rare pets

choices: Look for the otter or lemur
11112221121221.content: You decide to risk one of the three rare animals you can remember off the top of your head. You could turn around and look for where the raccoon ran off to, or you could seek out the otter or lemur.
11112221121221.title: One of the first three

choices: No, keep thinking of other animals!
11112221121222.content: You rack your brain to remember all your pets. Ordinarily you'd be better at remembering the,, but given the stress of your current situation, you have some trouble. You remember that one of your pets is, oddly enough, a baby elephant. She's definitely one of the strangest possible pets out there, but she might be useful with her prehensile trunk. Does that sound like a good pet to seek for help?
11112221121222.title: Elephant calf?

11112221122.content:
Star, your Yellow Lab, walks around the corner and stops as she spots the raccoon. Since you're so tiny, and most of your body is covered by the raccoon's paws, you assume that the dog can't see you, and hasn't noticed you.

However, as she walks towards the raccoon, the smaller animal rears up on her hind legs, wrapping her fingers around you to lift you up to her chest. You're glad to no longer be pinned under her, but being held like this isn't much better. You squirm, but to no avail. She's just too strong, and is busy hissing at the dog. She hasn't even noticed your struggles, it seems.

Star watches the raccoon for a bit, not put off by her aggressive display. The Yellow Lab seems to be wondering what to do next, but interestingly, the choice seems to be made for her. The raccoon suddenly stops hissing and starts sniffing, then makes a quiet growl before she drops you from her paws and turns, running away. Something must have scared her, but you're not sure what it is.

You look at her as she runs, and feel the ground very slightly shake as Star steps towards you. You look over at her as she walks in your direction, but you're not sure if she's seen you or if she's just following the raccoon. You notice her sniffing as she walks, clearly trying to determine what the raccoon smelled that scared her off. That's not your main concern now, though. All that matters is what she does next...
11112221122.title: Star finds the raccoon

111122211221.content: The Yellow Lab walks over to the tiny thing that the raccoon left behind, and sniffs at it. It smells familiar, but it mainly just smells like the raccoon. She can't figure out what exactly it is, but is a bit unsure of if she should eat it. Nonetheless, she feels hungry, and this seems like a good enough food item, so she scoops it up in her jaws and quickly eats it without a second thought...
111122211221.title: Bad end

111122211222.content:
Star keeps sniffing, and seemingly agitated by something, starts to run in the same direction that the raccoon went. You're not sure what's worried them, but it's possible that it was one of your larger pets that scared them.

Unfortunately for you, it seems that assumption is right, as you hear something big approaching from the opposite direction that the two animals ran. You slowly turn, and stare in surprise to see one of your two largest pets...
111122211222.title: One very, very big pet

1111222112222.content: The elephant calf, slowly making her way around the house, enters the hallway and walks down it. She could hear the raccoon and dog making noise, and wanted to see what they were up to. Unfortunately, she isn't paying attention to where she's going, and accidentally happens to step on a tiny creature too paralyzed with fear to dodge her feet.
1111222112222.title: Bad end

choices: She opens her mouth--she's gonna eat you!
She opens her mouth--but she's not hostile..?
111122212.content:
The raccoon stares at you for what feels like a long time. You're nervous about her response to you. She is usually gentle. But you're like a tiny prey item now. Who knows what she'll do to you?

Suddenly, the raccoon takes a few steps forward. Before you can react, her left hand reaches out to you, fingers splayed to grab. The digits, arranged just like human fingers, curl around your tiny torso and pluck you from the ground, squeezing you tightly and pinning your arms. You gasp as the air is forced form your lungs, and you freeze in shock. You've just been snatched up by a giant hand. That's certainly an experience you never thought you'd have. Seeing a giant animal is one thing--they exist in real life, after all, as whales and elephants and the like. Seeing your raccoon as a giant wasn't too surprising, due to that. But the sensation of being picked up... That was something else.

The raccoon's grip squeezes you tightly but not painfully. You'd never felt anything like it. It terrifies you, because you were totally under her control now, incapable of moving except if she moved you herself... But at the same time, the feeling of the hand and fingers around your body felt secure and safe, and the body heat and general softness especially made it feel very comfortable. In any other instance, this would be an enjoyable experience. Unfortunately, you are now being raised up to the raccoon's face, and her grip retains its tightness, and you fear she'll turn hostile. There was nothing you could do to stop her, after all.

The raccoon brings you an inch from her face, and you stare into her dark eyes as they examine you. You're powerless. She can do anything to you, and you can only watch. That makes you very worried, and you start thinking about how you can possibly resist her. Nothing comes to mind, though, and you can only hope that she's actually acting gentle and not just preparing to stuff you into her maw...
111122212.title: The giantess is gentle... Or is she?

1111222121.content: Unfortunately, she is indeed planning to stuff her master into her maw. The raccoon brings the tiny human into her mouth and starts chewing. Despite being her master, the human was just another piece of food for her once shrunken.
1111222121.title: Bad end

choices: Stay here with her for a bit, and have some fun with your new giantess friend
Have her carry you away, to try and find how you shrunk and how to undo it
1111222122.content:
The raccoon parts her jaws--it looks like she's actually going to eat you! You close your eyes in fear, preparing for that sensation, though you have no idea what it's like.

Then, to your surprise, the raccoon gives a happy barking kind of noise, and you open your eyes to look. She hasnt made any move to eat you beyond opening her mouth, which apparently was just to bark does that kean she's friendly?

Suddenly, her tongue slips from between her lips. Running quickly over your face, it gives it a thin coating of drool, making you splutter. However, the raccoon makes no other moves, simply staring at you quietly. You look back at her, and suddenly smile.

She's friendly.

She's almost twenty times your size and fully capable of killing you... But she's friendly. She's a giantess carnivore... But she chose to spare you. You smile more broadly, and tell her that she's a good girl. The raccoon growls happily.

Well, you now have a very big friend, one that will hold you in her hand and keep you safe. At least, it looks like it so far. Though you'd prefer to be able to move on your own, you admit that you'll probably need the raccoon's help to get around and remain safe. Until you can figure out what shrunk you and how to return to normal, you'll have to rely on her help. Thus, you hope this doesn't take too long.

So, what is your next move?
1111222122.title: She opens her mouth--but she's not hostile..?

choices: Play a game like fetch or hide and seek
Play in a... more unique way with her
11112221221.content:
Then again, though you don't want to stay like this, you realize this is an experience you might never have again. You might as well make the most of it now. And so you decide to put off looking for the way to return to normal, and spend some time with the raccoon.

She's still looking at you closely, and still holding you in her fist. She's waiting for her master's order, it seems. What do you want to do with her?
11112221221.title: Stay here with her for a bit, and have some fun

choices: Another animal appears! (and you might literally get hit this time)
11112221222.content:
If would be fun to spend some time playing around with your newly giant friend, but you know you need to get moving. You can't give in to your desires here--this is a life or death situation, and though it might be enjoyable to just play with the raccoon, you need to get back to normal size, and fast. So, you tell the raccoon that, and though she doesn't understand you, she seems to enjoy hearing you talk, so you keep talking out loud.

You remember waking up having shrunk to an inch tall. You don't remember much else though, and you can't imagine how that could have happened. You continue thinking anout your situation and what might have possibly caused it, while your raccoon continues to stare at you held in her fist. You are mostly oblivious to your situation, despite its uniqueness.

You start thinking about what you did the previous day, but as you start...
11112221222.title: The reason for shrinking?

choices: Interrogate your raccoon! (not like it will do much)
Continue trusting her (even though she might have caused all this)
111122212221.content:
You start thinking about what you did the day before. You suddenly remember doing some kind of science experiment, mixing certain chemicals together to create something interesting that you read about online. You start to wonder if you made a mistake and somehow created a mixture that could shrink you, but all the chemicals were common (and harmless), and you're sure you didn't mess up the mixture. Or did you?

The more you think about it, the more you start thinking that's the best idea for how you shrunk. Somehow, you must have messed up the experiment and come up with some new, unheard of way to mix common chemicals to make things shrink. You didn't drink any of the chemical, though, so you're not sure how you could have undergone its effects. Perhaps some of it splashed on you without your noticing. Or maybe...

You have many animals in your house, and some seem very smart, like your raccoon. You can't help but wonder if one of those animals poured the chemical on you in your sleep without your knowing. But if so, who did it? That would require lots of intelligence, to see the bottle, bring it to you, and pour its contents on you without waking you up. You can only think of a few of your pets with that intelligence--and it worries you to think that your raccoon is the primary option here. She's always been slightly mischievous, but always showed affection for you. She wouldn't dump potentially dangerous chemicals on you in your sleep, would she?

You look at your raccoon's cute face, not thinking that she could do such a thing. It's possible, though... So you decide to pursue this further, or just focus on returning to normal?
111122212221.title: Something hits you (figuratively)

1111222122212.content:
Questioning her would do nothing, because she can't understand your speech. Even so, you choose to not fully trust her, but you trust her enough to allow her to keep holding you and continue helping you out.

You continue thinking. If you shrunk due to the chemicals, you could do one of two things: try to make an antidote or test the mixture on something first to see if it really is able to shrink things. Both require you to go to the room you've made int your lab. You tell your raccoon a few times over and over to bring you there, and though she doesn't understand, your repetition of the word "lab" makes her finally get your meaning. She turns around, clutching you tightly to her furry chest. and begins walking.

Due to holding you in her left hand, she can't use it for walking. She instead hobbles forward on three limbs, in an awkward but not entirely unsteady motion. You presume she's used to carrying small objects like food or toys in one hand and walking with the other hand and her two feet, so this way of movement isn't entirely new to her. And that's lucky too, because she's moving quite fast. You'll reach the lab in no time.

The raccoon travels through the house, and you marvel at how huge everything is now that you're an inch tall. You do some estimations, and think that means you're somewhere around 70 times smaller, but thats just a rough estimate. The difference in scale is very interesting to you, and you want to explore every bit of the house and see how it is different when it's 70 times bigger. As a matter of fact, you start to wonder if you should do that now. You know what you need to do: reach your lab room and test out the chemical mixture. But still, you think you would be able to put that idea on hold and explore your house, especially with a giant friendly raccoon to protect you.

You can keep going, or stop and explore. What do you want to do?
1111222122212.title: Continue trusting her

11112221222121.content:
You decide to put necessity over fun. You tell your raccoon "lab" a few more times, maki sure she remembers where to go. She barks, and keeps going.

Being carried by her isn't unpleasant, you find, but it's bunch and almost makes you sick. You resist it, though, and just keep telling yourself that it will all be over soon. You're not really able to see where you're going, mainly due to your new size giving you a new perspective and making it tough to tell where you're going. Eventually, though, the raccoon slows down, and stops. You look around, and realize...
11112221222121.title: Keep going

choices: You decide to look around and find another method to get up besides climbing
111122212221211.content:
You've made it! Here's your lab room. You forget what room it was originally supposed to be when you bought the house, but you converted it into a lab soon after that, and you've thought of it as such ever since. It's a nice, but small, room, with everything you need to do science. Or at least, very basic science. After all, you can't do too dangerous of experiments on your own--it would be risky and potentially illegal.

The room's door is in the middle of one wall, and the room has a square floor plan. It has a window on the opposite wall, with a big desk under it and running along the wall. There are supplies in spins under it, and still a few chemicals sitting in bottles on top of the table. There's a chair in front of that desk, and another desk with an old computer on the right wall. The left wall has many filing cabinets, which have information and notes inside them.

You order your raccoon to bring you up to the main table, and she lumbers over in her three legged gait. She looks up, and growls. You realize she probably can't climb while holding you in her hand. You try to think about what she can do instead...
111122212221211.title: It's the lab!

choices: The raccoon finally decides you're too tasty to let go
1111222122212112.content:
...but unfortunately, she chooses for you.

Suddenly, she raises you to her face and opens her mouh, revealing the fleshy and slimy pink interior and the many sharp teeth around it. Before you can react, she moves you towards it and shoves you inside. You're too big to fit in completely, and your legs remain outside, but your torso and above are left lying on the raccoon's pulsing tongue. You're too stunned to struggle as the raccoon closes her jaws, making sure to not apply too much pressure so her teeth don't hurt you. Then, you're jostled around--presumably, the raccoon is now climbing. You continue to not struggle, realizing that she's simply freeing up her hands and doesn't want to eat you. After a few seconds, you feel tightness surround your legs. The raccoon has grabbed then in her hand, and is about to pull you out, luckily.

But she doesn't immediately. Instead, she pulls you out a bit, then moves you back in. You feel her tongue moving under you, partially curling around you and squeezing you. With fear, you realize she's playing with you in her mouth like she might with food. You're suddenly pushed to the roof of her mouth and sucked on, the squishy tongue pushing into you. You start to struggle, but you can't scream or else her saliva will enter your mouth.

The raccoon continues to suck on you, murring in pleasure. She's liking this way too much. Meanwhile, you continue to struggle... But is it for nothing?
1111222122212112.title: Raccoon maw

11112221222121121.content:
The raccoon seems to recognize your struggles, because she suddenly stops and parts her jaws, pulling you out of her mouth and putting you on the table in front of her. You're shaking from fear, despite having been made very warm in her maw, and suddenly realize just how little control you have over this whole situation. Even though your raccoon is obviously friendly, she can still manhandle you.

Your raccoon seems sad. She realizes that she scared you, and lowers herself down to you, bringing her snout close and nuzzling you gently. That also helps wipe some of her drool off you, which you appreciate. Still, that experience helped you understand just how dire this situation is. Being held in her hand is one thing, but being right in front of her throat, clamped between her sharp teeth, is another. You were so close to death, and there was nothing you could have done had she suddenly decided she liked your taste more than she liked you as a person.

You try to wipe off the rest of the raccoon's drool, but most of it stays on. You really hope you can wash it off soon. You turn away from the raccoon, finally getting a good look at the bottles on the table top, each of which is way bigger than you. You recognize them as the same ones you'd left out yesterday...
11112221222121121.title: The raccoon finally stops

111122212221211211.content:
It's gone! You fall to your knees in shock. You hadn't expected this--finding that mixture was important. You would have been able to test if it truly did shrink you, and thus, have a lead towards finding an antidote...

You hang your head low. Even worse, the fact that it's gone means one of your pets must have stolen it. You try to think top which of them has the intelligence and dexterity to take it and use it--because you're still mostly sure that is how you shrunk: one of your pets taking it and pouring it on you while you slept.

Suddenly, it hits you. You don't know how you forgot about these pets until right now, but you presume it had something to do with being so stressed about shrinking. You've already chosen to trust the raccoon and believe that she didn't steal the bottle, and if she didn't, that leaves just two animals with the intelligence and dexterity/prehensility (and size) to take the bottle and use its contents on you...
111122212221211211.title: The mixture is missing!

choices: Try getting help from a different animal
1111222122212112112.content:
It must be the ring-tailed lemur, Plio. Like the raccoon, she is another of the less common pets that you just so happen to keep. You adopted her when she was a baby, because she was being offered to a skilled animal raiser, and you fit the bill what with your many common and exotic pets. The two of you became relatively close, but she was still troublesome sometimes. You start to think that she might well be a good suspect, because not only has she shown many signs of being very intelligent, she also has prehensile hands with which to manipulate the mixture bottle and has a troublesome nature, all of which would fit into your theory of one of your pets stealing the mixture and using it on you.

The only problem is, you have no idea where she is. During the day, she usually wanders around the house, and since it's morning now, she won't be in any certain location, making it tough to locate her. Plus, if she really did shrink you, she might have gone into hiding to avoid you. You've got two ideas, then: start looking randomly through the house, or find some other pet with a better sense of smell than the raccoon to help you locate Plio.
1111222122212112112.title: The suspect

11112221222121121122.content:
The raccoon has helped you well so far, but her sense of smell isn't the best--it's good, but there are pets of yours that are better. Namely, there are two dogs you keep: Luna the husky and Star the Yellow Lab. You decide to go to their room and get their help--or at least, try to get their help without getting eaten.

So, you turn to the raccoon, and raise your arms. She takes the hint, and reaches down with her left hand again, carefully wrapping her digits around you and picking you up. She turns and walks to the edge of the table, then makes two big drops to the chair seat and then the floor, a much easier way to get down than up. The drops shake you, but you survive unharmed, and the raccoon holds you out in front of her face and stares at you questioningly, awaiting your orders.

You tell her to go to the dog room, and repeat it a few times. Eventually, something about the word "dog" must have clicked in her, because she growls happily and holds you close to her chest, running off through the house once again. It's not long before she stops, and you look around to see that she's successfully carried you into the dog room. It's a small room with three pet beds--two for your dogs, one for your cat. The cat is in bed, sleeping and oblivious to everything, and won't be of much help. One of the dogs' beds is empty. The other is occupied, though, with...
11112221222121121122.title: Try getting help from a different animal

111122212221211211221.content:
Star is lying in her bed, awake but tired, it seems. Her ears twitch as the raccoon approaches with you, and her moves her head just enough for one of her eyes to see you. When she spots the raccoon carrying a tiny and strange-looking creature, her eyes seem to widen, and she turns her head to face you head-on.

The raccoon carefully places you on the ground close to Star's bed, and stands up onto her hind legs, looking down at you. You're focused on Star, though. The dog is bigger than the raccoon, and you realize with fear that she seems able to fit your whole body in her mouth. Still, you wanted this, and you steel yourself. Star is your pet. She should obey you, even though you're smaller than her.

Star continues staring at you, wondering why the racoon brought her this tiny creature. You walk forward, somehow overcoming your fear by telling yourself that she's your dog and should recognize you, and begin talking, calling Star by her name and telling her who you are. Star seems to recognize your voice, and leans her head towards you, sniffing you. Her inhalations almost knock you off balance, but you remain standing, and Star moves her head back slightly, seeming to be considering your scent.

You fall silent and stare up at the gigantic dog, hoping she remembers your voice and smell... otherwise, you're in the perfect position to be made into a snack...
111122212221211211221.title: Star the Yellow Lab

choices: Leave the raccoon and just go with Star
Let the raccoon carry you, and bring Star with you
1111222122212112112211.content:
As you'd hoped, Star is gentle, and seems to see you as her master. She makes no hostile moves, and simply continues to watch you as you stand there looking up at her. You glance back at the raccoon, who is still standing there and waiting for your next move, presumably. You look back up at Star, and decide you might as well start with what you came here for. You've successfully found a friendly dog, whose nose will help you find Plio, but you need to get her on the trail first. and you have a plan to do just that.

You call Star's name to get her full attention, and tell her to listen carefully. Though you're sure she won't be able to understand anything, you hope you can get some meaning across as you reveal your plan to her. Your plan is to go to Plio's "wardrobe" and get something of hers. She has a wardrobe because, as a female primate, she has the same... features as a human female on her chest, and it always felt awkward for you to look at them, so you've trained her to wear a bra and skirt which you made out of fabric and keep in a special wardrobe. Not only does it make you feel more comfortable around her, it looks really cute. Your plan is to get one of her pieces of clothing and get Star to smell it, then use its scent to track Plio down. You figure that an article of Plio's clothing will have the strongest scent of hers on it, and will be the best to use to help you find her, and hopefully, the bottle of that mysterious mixture with her. You tell Star all this, and though she simply gazes at you with her deep brown eyes the whole time, you hope she picked up on the meaning of some of your words.

Before you can begin this plan, though, you need to figure out a way to travel with Star. It would be too risky to walk by yourself, and too slow as well. The raccoon is still here, and she could carry you; this might be best, because Star lacks much real prehensility, and the only two options for traveling with her would be to ride on her back or (you shudder at this idea) inside her mouth. Still, it might be best to leave the raccoon behind and just go with Star, so you can give orders to her more directly instead of being held closer to ground level by the raccoon, but it's up to you.

So, what do you choose to do?
1111222122212112112211.title: She acts friendly

11112221222121121122111.content: You finally decide, and tell the raccoon to stay. You'd like to have her with you, but you don't think you can really handle two giant animals at once, even if both of them have proven themselves obedient. The raccoon looks sad, but backs off before turning and leaving at your command. You then turn to Star. There are two ways this can go. Or more precisely, two places you can go: her back or her maw. As you stare up at your enormous Yellow Lab, gently panting and watching you, awaiting your orders, you decide you'd prefer to ride...
11112221222121121122111.title: Leave the raccoon and just go with Star

choices: Go to Plio's room! If she stole the mixture, she might have it there
Just wander around the house and see if you can find the mixture
111122212221211211221111.content: Though risky, you believe being on Star's back beats being in her mouth by a long shot. So, you start ordering her to lie down. She remembers that command, luckily, and does so, giving you a chance to walk over and climb up onto her head. It's difficult, and you're afraid you might be hurting her, but you're able to make it onto her head and down to the base of her neck without incident. Seeming to tell that you're in place, the dog stands up, and you're momentarily terrified of the height you're now at above the ground. Nonetheless, you remain brave and prepare to tell Star where to go. The problem is, you're not entirely sure where...
111122212221211211221111.title: On her back

choices: She closes her mouth, enveloping you into darkness.
She keeps still, waiting for more instructions.
111122212221211211221112.content:
While you would definitely feel much more comfortable on Star's back, you are not sure if you would be able to hold on, or keep your balance. Even with your increased density, a fall from that height would not be good at all. So, you decide the safer, yet scarier route in the canines mouth. You call up to your gargantuan pet, attempting to get her closer. You command her to lay down, and she promptly obeys. Still panting, her long tongue is fairly close to you now. You walk up to it, but it is still a bit too high up. You decide to back away, giving her room to lay her head down as well. Her muzzle follows you and is now close enough for you to touch. However, much to your frustration, Star closed her mouth. You climb up to her sealed lips and attempt to pry them open. Eventually, Star begins to understand what you want and, though slightly confused, opens her mouth. The sudden movement throws you off balance however, and you tumble into her open mouth.

         You land on her giant, pink, slimy tongue, and your face is pressed into it. You roll on to your back, and look up at Star's parted jaws.

         How does she respond?
111122212221211211221112.title: Not Insane, I swear!

choices: You don't run into any trouble
11112221222121121122112.content:
Because both giant animals have proven themselves friendly, you decide you could probably handle controlling them both at once, and bringing them both with you. And between the two, you'd prefer the raccoon to carry you. You turn and walk up to her, your arms raised. You tell her to pick you up, and though she doesn't understand your words, she can guess by your body language. Carefully, she reaches down and curls her clawed fingers around your tiny body, lifting you off the ground and towards her face.

You glance back at Star. You think she seems disappointed that you prefer the raccoon to her, but it's the safest way to travel. You then start telling the dog and the raccoon to go to Plio's room. Again, they don't understand the command exactly, but they recognize the word "Plio" and can guess where you want them to go. And so, the raccoon hurries off on three legs, the much bigger dog plodding behind her, and you're glad to see they are in fact going towards where Plio's room should be.

As you travel there, though...
11112221222121121122112.title: Let the raccoon carry you

choices: Plio the lemur--the very animal you've been looking for
111122212221211211221121.content:
You hear something approaching. You have no idea what it is, but it's something big--well, bigger than you at least, but many things are at this scale. You listen closely, and it seems Star has noticed it too, as she begins growl behind the raccoon and you.

Suddenly, the animal appears from around the corner, and you see it is...
111122212221211211221121.title: Something from around the corner

choices: Another of your exotic pets: an otter
1111222122212112112211212.content: You were thinking how lucky it would be to find Plio so soon, but it's not Plio that appears from around the corner. Instead it is...
1111222122212112112211212.title: Another animal

1111222122212112112212.content: Unfortunately, the Yellow Lab doesn't seem to recognize the scent or sound of her master. Instead, she sees a tiny speck that might taste good. She leans her head forward, licking up the tiny human and tasting for a bit before deciding to swallow...
1111222122212112112212.title: Bad end

choices: She seems to not recognize you
111122212221211211222.content:
Lying in the bed is Luna, your white-coated and blue-eyed husky. She's energetic and young, but mostly obedient. She does seem to like small things, though, and mainly, playing with them... in her mouth, usually. This is not ideal, but it's the only choice you have. Besides, she's already staring right at you, held in the raccoon's hand--you're not sure if she recognizes you, but she definitely has noticed you.

The raccoon walks up to Luna's bed, and the two look at each other for a few moments. Then, the raccoon carefully places you on the ground close to Luna's bed, and stands up onto her hind legs, looking down at you. You're focused on Luna, though. The dog is smaller than Star would have been, but still bigger than the raccoon, and you realize with fear that she seems able to fit your whole body in her mouth--and likely will.

You plan to start walking forward, overcoming you fear by telling yourself that she's your dog and should recognize you, and begin calling Luna by her name and telling her who you are... but before you can, she's already gotten up and moved towards you. You stare at this massive animal approaching you, and freeze in place. You hear the raccoon backing up, not wanting to oppose Luna, and the husky moves until her front paws are on either side of you, and her head is right above you, angling down. Her bright blue eyes gaze into yours, and she seems to be examining you. You just hope she correctly recognizes you as her master, and doesn't make any aggressive move. You think to yourself that Star would have been much less... forward about this, probably remaining in her bed and sniffing you instead of getting up and basically cornering you.

Luna lowers her head, but her jaws remain closed. She sniffs you a bit, seeming to recognize you, as she gives a small whine. You look up at her, and she moves her head up again, looking at you intently. This is better than you'd expected this to go... it almost seems like she recognizes you...
111122212221211211222.title: Luna the husky

1111222122212112112221.content:
Luna stares down at you, then lowers her head again, sniffing a bit more. You wonder what she's thinking, but quickly get your answer. Her tongue emerges form between her lips and pushes into you, knocking you onto the floor with a strong lick. The tongue retracts, and you're left wiping the spit from your face, only to see that Luna has opened her mouth again, revealing the now-terrifyingly enlarged interior. The tongue snakes out again, moving to loop around you and go between the floor and your back. You realize she's about to take you into her maw, but you're powerless to resist her. You only stare in fear as her tongue scoops you off the floor and draws you into her mouth, the jaws closing behind you.

Unlike the raccoon's mouth, Luna's is big enough to fit you entirely. This, however, doesn't mean it's more comfortable--instead it means she has total control over you, and is ready to use it. Her tongue deftly curls around you, squeezing you tightly over and over, applying pressure repeatedly. She seems to be trying to get your flavor off, and begins growling with pleasure. Just like the raccoon, you realize, she seems to be really, really liking your taste--which terrifies you, considering you're right in front of her throat. She uncurls her tongue from around you soon, becoming still and leaving you lying on top of the giant muscle, terrified about suddenly being pushed backwards into the throat and your death. But, luckily, she doesn't seem to want to do that. Instead, she simply begins pushing you around her mouth with her tongue, seeming to play with you. You're knocked painfully against her teeth, pinned to the roof of her mouth and sucked on, moved underneath her tongue and pressed down into the pool of saliva down there... every so often, you feel her tongue coil around you again and hold you in place, and hear a loud gulping noise, and realize that she's doing that to intentionally avoid swallowing you whenever she swallows her spittle. Despite her care for you, you still dislike this situation, and the thorough coating of dog drool you're getting. Though you've managed to not swallow any or get any in your eyes, it'll take a while to wash it all off.

You lose track of time, and start to wonder why your raccoon hasn't done anything to save you. Still, you can't resist, and just try to keep your mouth and eyes shut, hoping she doesn't start liking your taste enough to swallow you whole...
1111222122212112112221.title: She recognizes you... and your taste

11112221222121121122211.content: For some reason, Luna seems to not recognize her master's taste. She doesn't seem to miss that the taste is good, though, because after sucking on the tiny human for a little bit, she proceeds to swallow her catch whole.
11112221222121121122211.title: Bad end

choices: You hear another animal coming into the room--Star, maybe?
The raccoon tries to save you
11112221222121121122212.content:
You don't know how long it all takes, but eventually, you see light again through your closed eyelids, and feel yourself fall from the humid interior of Luna's maw and land on something soft. You use that surface to wipe your face off as best you can, looking up to see that you've been deposited in Luna's bed. The husky steps over you and spins a few times before lying down, remaining mostly on one half of the bed with you lying on the other. The stares at you, her jaws parted and her tongue hanging out as she pants. You roll around on the bed a bit to try to wipe off more drool, and finally give up--you'll need a shower to undo all that. You find it tough the stand on the bed, and so you sit down and lean against the side, looking up at the giant dog in front of you.

You survived, luckily, but now you're trapped in her bed, which has high raised edges, and she could totally do all that again if she chose. You decide you need to try again to get her to recognize you, so she won't think you're a chew toy or any other kind of toy, which she seems to think you are. You start talking again, like before, using her name and your name too. Luna doesn't seem to react much, and you realize that she probably doesn't see you as her master anymore.

You sigh, finally giving up. If Star were here, she'd probably still respect you as her master. But Luna always has been a bit of a troublemaker, and so you're not too surprised that she'd take this chance to mess with you. You're at least glad she spared you, though--being eaten by your own dog would have been an awful way to go.

You and Luna sit in silence for a bit, broken only by her panting. You wonder what she's thinking, and guess she might be considering what to do to you next. It's clear that she doesn't recognize you as her master anymore--she probably remembers your smell and taste, but she doesn't believe she should obey you anymore. That's definitely not the situation you were hoping to get into--instead of getting one of your dogs to help you find Plio the lemur, you only got one of them to manhandle you. You wonder what will happen next, and just hope it's something good for once...
11112221222121121122212.title: Luna's bed

choices: Another pet you haven't yet encountered while small
111122212221211211222121.content:
You suddenly hear something from outside the room. Luna looks at the entrance to the room, having stopped panting and started twitching her ears and nose. Then, she begins to growl. Something's coming, and she doesn't like what it is.

You can't see over the edge of Luna's bed, but while she's distracted, you manage to find a way to pull yourself up just enough to see out. And what you see is the animal that's got Luna upset...
111122212221211211222121.title: You hear another animal coming into the room...

choices: Luna won, and will keep you for herself
Star won, and Luna must give you to her
1111222122212112112221211.content:
Into the room walks Star, the Yellow Lab. She's bigger and older than Luna, but usually nicer. You start to wonder if she can help you with this situation. The Lab seems confused by Luna's growling, and gives a few whines back.

Then she sees you. She yelps and stumbles back a few steps, staring straight at you, before recovering and walking closer. Luna glances down at you and sees that you seem to be trying to get out of her bed, and she reaches over and hits you with a front paw, knocking you off the edge of her bed and pinning you under the paw. You can't see what's going on now, but you can hear Luna and Star growling and barking at each other. They don't seem to be actually fighting, or doing much more, though. It seems like they're arguing over what to do with you, or who should be allowed to keep you. You hope Star wins--she'd likely be more obedient than Luna.

You get your answer soon; it seems like...
1111222122212112112221211.title: Arguing dogs

111122212221211211222122.content:
Suddenly, Luna stops panting and starts sniffing the air. Her ears perk up, and she begins to growl. You wonder what's got her worried... until a shadow looms over you, and you glance up to see the raccoon reaching over the side of Luna's bed, both hands outstretched towards you. They pin you between their palms, and you're yanked out of the bed as Luna barks. The raccoon turns and runs as fast as she can on her hind legs, holding you in front of herself. Your arms are pinned, and you constantly feel like you're about to slip out of her grasp, but you realize that she's trying to save you form Luna, and appreciate that.

Even so, you hear Luna chasing after you, and though the raccoon got a head start, she's much slower, and Luna is about to catch up. And if she does, who knows what she'll do to the raccoon who stole you away from her... or to you?

As the raccoon runs through the house, though, something unexpected happens that decides the ending of this chase earlier than any of you three thought...
111122212221211211222122.title: Run!

choices: She moves her paw away from on top of you... Only to open her maw again!
Another animal arrives, and tries to stop Luna
1111222122212112112221221.content:
Suddenly, the raccoon lets out a yelping noise, and trips somehow. You can only watch as the ground rushes up to hit you, unable to do anything to prevent it due to still being in the raccoon's grasp. Because of how she's holding you out in front of her, her hands take most of the actual impact, but you're still hurt by it, and then her body falls on top of you. It doesn't flatten you, though, and she simply tumbles a few times, letting you go by accident partway through. You roll to a stop, and after you get your bearings, you notice the raccoon struggling to get up. Suddenly, you hear Luna barking, and the raccoon looks towards where she'd been running from, and turns and continues running away. You hear heavy paw steps, and look over to see Luna approaching, having scared off the raccoon.

This isn't good. You try to get up, but the husky pins you under one of her front paws. You're stuck lying face down, with your waist and below trapped under the giant toe. Despite struggling, you're powerless to resist as she lowers her head and begins licking you over and over, pushing you hard with each lick. She begins to murr with pleasure, just like when she had you inside her mouth earlier, not letting up as she runs her tongue over you from waist to head over and over. It's painful to get your body pushed down into the hard floor, but all your struggles do nothing. You just lie there and hope she finishes soon.

Luckily for you, she seems to have already gotten most of your taste off from when she was playing with you inside her mouth earlier. She soon stops licking you, but doesn't do anything for a few moments afterward. You can't see what she's doing, due to being pinned, but you figure it out soon enough...
1111222122212112112221221.title: Pinned and licked

11112221222121121122212211.content: The dog removes her paw from the tiny human, and lowers her head. She's gotten enough of the taste, and doesn't see any point to keeping the human around any longer. After keeping the tiny human in her mouth for a few seconds, just to see if there's any lingering taste, she finally swallows.
11112221222121121122212211.title: Bad end

choices: Star leaves, and Luna is alone with you again
Star gets Luna to release you, and takes you for herself
11112221222121121122212212.content:
You hear a loud bark, and faintly hear the click and clack of claws on the floor. The pressure on top of you increases slightly as Luna pushes down on you a bit more, and you hear her growling. You look to the side, and see another one of your pets approaching. But this time, the sight makes you happy: it is Star, your Yellow Lab. She has always been gentle and kind, unlike the mischievous Luna, and you believe that she might actually help you out.

As you are lying face down, you can't tell what Luna is doing exactly, but by looking over your shoulder, you can catch enough of a glimpse to tell that she is staring at Star as the large yellow dog approaches. She pushes down on you even more, seemingly in an attempt to prevent you from escaping or being stolen by Star, and you grunt in pain. The pressure is very uncomfortable, but you're not being crushed, which you feel grateful for. Even so, you hope that Luna relents soon.

You look over at Star, and see her brown eyes gazing at you. She has clearly noticed you, but you can't tell whether she recognizes you. She might have just mistaken you for a toy or even for a bug, but it is possible that she recognizes you based on sight or smell.

The husky pinning you down continues to growl quietly as Star walks up to her and pauses a few feet away. Star looks at Luna, as if trying to decide what to do: to leave, or act aggressively and take what the husky has caught. Though Star scares you due to her sheer size, being as big as a house compared to you, you believe that she would treat you better than Luna, and hope that she manages to take you from the husky.
11112221222121121122212212.title: Another animal arrives, and tries to stop Luna

1111222122212112112221222.content:
You're in a hallway when it happens. From around the corner, Star suddenly appears. The raccoon doesn't stop in time, and bumps into her legs. Star stumbles with a yelp, and you're dropped from the raccoon's grasp, landing underneath Star. The raccoon gets to all fours and backs up, only for Luna to bark and pounce on her, biting at her tail. The raccoon lets out a surprised, high-pitched barking noise and runs past Star into another room. Luna starts to chase her, but Star steps in her way and growls angrily. You realize that neither of them see you, and you decide to sneak away before one of them steps on you. You hurry away, successfully avoiding being spotted, and glance over your shoulder repeatedly to see how they're doing. Star is bigger than Luna, but less fierce, and has always acted more peaceful that the husky. Even so, she's older and has always been the dominant one between the two dogs you own, and so Luna quickly backs down, turning and walking back to her room.

Star watches her go, but then begins sniffing the air. She's caught the scent of something, and you realize it's probably you. By now, you've snuck underneath a small, low table against the hallway wall, and could likely avoid detection if you stayed here--something you find desirable, especially following your encounter with Luna. Then again, Star has always been much nicer than Luna, and going to Star would possibly lead to you allying with her and using her to find Plio the lemur, and hopefully get closer to solving this problem...
1111222122212112112221222.title: Star appears

choices: Let her carry you in her mouth
11112221222121121122212221.content:
Star is very nice--you know that. She's less likely to hurt you than many of your other pets. Besides, this is basically your only chance at getting a pet to help you that can sniff out Plio. So, you leave your hiding spot, calling Star's name. The Lab looks around confusedly before finally spotting you, and giving a short yelp of surprise as she stumbles back. She quickly plods over to you and lies down, her forelegs coming down to your left and right. The size of the dog disturbs you again, but you remain confident that she'll help you. She begins sniffing you, and you call her a good girl and ask if she remembers you. After a little bit, Star snorts and whines, and moves her head forward to nuzzle you. It knocks you over, but you're happy anyway. She remembers you, and isn't acting hostile.

You keep calling her a good girl, and pat her snout as she continues nuzzling you on the ground. You realize that, in this position, she could probably crush you by moving her nose down just a bit harder, but you're sure she won't do that. She clearly is acting gentle to you, and you like that. Unlike Luna, Star seems willing to obey and help you, and so you decide to test that by explaining your plan to her.

You crawl out from under Star's snout and stand up, resting your hands on her nose and looking into her eyes. You tell her to listen carefully, and though you're sure she won't be able to understand anything, you hope you can get some meaning across. Your plan is to go to Plio's "wardrobe" and get something of hers. She has a wardrobe because, as a female primate, she has the same... features as a human female on her chest, and it always felt awkward for you to look at them, so you've trained her to wear a bra and skirt which you made out of fabric and keep in a special wardrobe. Not only does it make you feel more comfortable around her, it looks really cute. Your plan is to get one of her pieces of clothing and get Star to smell it, then use its scent to track Plio down. You figure that an article of Plio's clothing will have the strongest scent of hers on it, and will be the best to use to help you find her, and hopefully, the bottle with her. You tell Star all this, and though she simply gazes at you with her deep brown eyes the whole time, you hope she picked up on the meaning of some of your words.

Before you can begin this plan, though, you need to figure out a way to travel with Star. It would be too risky to walk by yourself, and too slow as well. Star carrying you would be best... but unlike the racoon, she lacks much real prehensility. There are two options you have: you can sit on her head or back and ride her like an enormous horse, or (you shudder at this idea) let her carry you inside her mouth. The latter is grosser but more secure, as you have a risk of falling off her back--but you won't be covered in drool if you're on her back (most likely).

Which do you choose?
11112221222121121122212221.title: Helpful Star

choices: She makes it there and opens it fine
111122212221211211222122211.content:
You definitely would prefer to not be inside another animal's mouth ever again, so you choose to go on Star's back. You walk around her, getting to her side and struggling to climb up onto her. She doesn't resist, and allows you to scramble up her side and onto her back. You'd expected it to be similar to riding on horseback, but the size ratio between you and Star at this scale is way bigger than between you and a horse normally, and you can't even straddle her back with your legs like you would on a horse. So, you just sit cross-legged and try to keep your center of gravity low so you don't fall off.

Star seems to tell you're in place, because she stands up, which makes you nervous once you realize how high up you are. Still, you're glad you haven't fallen off yet, and intend to keep it that way. You start trying to tell Star what you want her to do--you tell her your plan again and keep repeating "Plio" and "wardrobe", and it seems like she eventually gets it. She starts walking through the house, heading in what you can tell is the direction of the room you'd set up for Plio.

When you make it there, it seems empty. The room is used by a few of your more exotic pets--this is where the raccoon and the otter live, along with Plio the lemur. All their beds are empty, though. Plio's wardrobe, attached to the wall, is right ahead of you, and you tell Star to open its door. Opening doors is a trick you taught Star before, and unfortunately, she's used it to sneak into your room and sleep on your bed with you several times despite your repeated scoldings. Luckily, it's getting some good use now, as Star moves towards the wardrobe to open it.
111122212221211211222122211.title: Riding Star

choices: She grows bored and carries you away
Star finally is able to reach Plio and attack
1111222122212112112221222112.content:
As Star walks towards the wardrobe, though, she seems agitated. She sniffs the air and growls quietly, and you ask what's wrong.

You get your answer very quickly, as you get the feeling you're being watched and glance over your shoulder to see a giant shadowy form hanging from the top of the door to the exotic pets' room. You recognize it as the very animal you've been searching for: Plio the lemur. She is wearing the bandeau and skirt made (somewhat shoddily) by yourself for her to wear, and is hanging onto the top of the door by one hand. Her feet are dangling, and her tail is slowly waving back and forth. Shes looking right at you, and you're about to tell Star, but then Plio makes her move.

She brings her feet up, soles against the door, and pushes off, jumping at you. You try to stand up and jump out of her way, but right as you get to your feet, she's already pounced on you. You gasp as one of her hands snatches you up, the fingers wrapping tightly around you, and you're swept off Star's back as Plio continues her jump, landing on the floor in front of the dog. Star stumbles back, notices you in Plio's fist, and barks angrily before lunging at the lemur. Plio is too fast, though, and leaps up on top of her wardrobe, clutching you tightly. You're familiar with the sensation of being snatched now, so you're not too afraid or stunned. In fact, you're almost amused by how this situation almost reminds you of King Kong--or Queen Kong in this case.

Plio hisses down at Star as the Yellow Lab barks repeatedly, but Plio is out of Star's reach and seems to know it, as the lemur quiets down and raises you up to her face after not too long. You see her grinning, which you interpret as her baring her teeth aggressively, or in a dominating way. And really, it makes sense. You're under her power now. She has you held firmly in her giant fist. She's dominated you...

...But you won't stand for that. You've been trying to get back to normal since you shrunk, and you're not going to give up. Even when you're snatched by a giant hand, you're not going to just let its owner control you. And so, you squirm and struggle all you can, and even yell for Star to attack Plio. You don't care if she gets hurt--this is a dangerous situation, and you need to get out of Plio's grasp fore she does anything harmful. She has always been rather troublesome, and you wouldn't be surprised if she was planning to harm you in your new tiny stature.

Star continues barking, and you continues struggling, as Plio simply grins at you and seems to enjoy your squirming in her fist. Before too long, though...
1111222122212112112221222112.title: Kidnapped off the dog's back by Queen Kong

11112221222121121122212221121.content:
Unfortunately for you, the giant lemur seems to quickly grow bored of this. She's just hanging there, after all, and there's nothing Star can do. She'd prefer to go somewhere else to do whatever she's planning to do to you, and so, she tightens her grasp on you to ensure she doesn't drop you and leaps off of her wardrobe. Plio flies over Star, landing on the other side of the dog and running along the ground. Star acts quickly and turns to chase the lemur, while you just do your best to not squirm and slip out of Plio's grasp. You don't like being held by her, especially since you don't know if she's planning to be nice or not, but you prefer being in her fist to being dropped and potentially trampled by her as she runs.

Plio is surprisingly fast, and makes quick turns and u-turns to evade Star. There are a few times where it seems like she'll catch the two of you, but Plio always avoids the dog. Eventually, the lemur begins heading somewhere that makes you worried...
11112221222121121122212221121.title: She grows bored and carries you away

111122212221211211222122211212.content:
Plio, still grasping your tiny body tightly in her human-like fist, rushes towards a door you recognize as the door to your backyard. You live on a large plot of land, and the backyard has many enclosures and areas for pets that require big spaces or special environments.

It's actually a pretty confusing backyard, with lots of little buildings and pens popping up here and there, with trees and other plants appearing very common. It mostly reminds you of a forest, and it indeed was one before your house was built. Still, some of the backyard breaks the foresty pattern and instead is a simple open field, spreading far and enclosed by wooden fences.

You have time to ponder the details about your backyard as Plio reaches the door, leaps up, and grabs the doorknob with the hand not holding you. She gives it a quick twist, and the door swings open from her weight. She drops down and hurries out, not even bothering to close the door behind her.
