Knowing of some possibilities that could result from a trip to the deep at this size, you decide to stay at the surface. Several seabirds call out from above as they pass you by, merely interested in reaching the shoreline. You seem to drift endlessly, being bumped by what appears to be tiny little sea creatures. You could barely see them, but they are indeed there...and there are a lot of them. As far as you could see, you were simply surrounded by the tiny organisms. You could almost make out their shapes, interestingly enough. Well, interestingly because you're immensely bored and worried as you drift.

A half hour passes without incident, and you notice a shadow begin to emerge below you. It progressively gets bigger, and bigger, and bigger. As a matter of fact, it now seems enormous at this point. Then, it hits you. Having no time to escape, the titanic maw of a rorqual whale greets you and the thousands of other plankton around you. The maw closes around you, filtering out some of the tiny plankton as water rushes out of its mouth. You also get caught in the baleen. You find that the material is so tough as to actually prevent you from escape. You straggle helplessly as you see the gigantic tongue about to sweep you off of the baleen. It sweeps gently over the tongue, taking you and 760 plankton off of one side of the mouth, and hang on as the tongue sweeps another 850 plankton off of the other side. Your heart nearly pounds out of your chest, but somehow you manage to remain calm as the giant tongue then tilts up, making you and the 1,000's of plankton fall near its gullet. Then, with the biggest swallow you've ever heard, you and the plankton are sent into a tiny gullet, which is somehow able to fit you and the plankton all in at once. You can feel them crawling all over your skin as you descend into it's massive gut. The room is bigger than a house to you, but you can't really notice that. It also contains no distinctive odor. Almost immediately after entering, you begin to feel a light tingling sensation on your body, and are actually able to withstand the full digestive force of the whale's acids...for a while, anyway. Sleep comes sooner than you think, and your body begins to contribute its one iota to powering this massive powerhouse. That's a heck of a way to end your vacation...and your life.
1411222.title: Et tu, Plankton?

choices: Mr. Sparrow's got a mate to feed.
Mr. Sparrow seems to have a hole in his beak.
1412.content:
Heading out towards the water may end up being the last and worst idea you'll ever have. You think this, and decide to stay on land and wait for help. There's only one small problem (well, besdies your size, of course): You never told anyone you were coming here. It could definitely be quite the long while before any person would come to help.

You stay on your beach towel, seeming to serve as a force of comfort, perhaps even a hiding spot in a pinch. There also appears to be another problem: You didn't bring food for yourself. This doesn't appear to be as big of a problem as being picked off by something.

While thinking deeply, you notice an earthworm peeking up from the sand. Yes, an earthworm. One that should normally be obtaining nutrients from the soil. Then you see two, then three. What?! There must be a nutrient deficiency in the soil, as earthworms are an uncommon sight in such a place. A seagull picks off two of the earthworms, gobbling one after the other, then flying off. You sigh, thinking these earthworms serve as good distractions. You see another uncommon sight heading towards the beach: a sparrow. It seems to have missed the earthworm, and lands on the beach towel. Try to refrain from thought like that in the future.

The sparrow makes quick hops towards you. You back up, but it's too late. The bird already has you grasped in its beak, and begins to fly off with a new catch. It appears to be a lucky day for Mr. sparrow...or is it?
1412.title: The Smallest Standing

14121.content:
The sparrow had a tight grip on you, barely allowing for any sort of a struggle at all. You fly beyond the beach, beyond several resorts before reaching a tall tree somwhere at the outskirts of town. You arrive at the nest, where the sparrow drops your body out of its maw, but only to be faced by the bird's mate. Slightly smaller than her male counterpart, she cocks her head to the side, and the male chirps to her...almost as if signaling to her somehow. For a while you watch the two birds, absolutely petrified. They don't seem to be doing much of anything at all. After about 20 seconds, you try to bypass the nest, only to be stopped by the female's body in front of you. She sidestepped to avoid letting you out. You try the other way, but the male stops you as well. There's no way out. You're trapped.

At this point, the only thing you could do is to jump out of the nest. It may seem ridiculous, but the birds aren't going to let you walk out of their nest. You sigh in desperation, and jump out of the nest. It is then that the female springs into action, flitting out of the tree and catching you in midair with a snatch and a gulp. You quickly make your way to the bird's crop, and the female bird settles down. Struggling madly within the crop, you hear continuing chirps from the female, but they're different than any you've ever heard. Perhaps it was...enjoying your struggles? You stamina drains, and you fall to an everlasting rest.

The male heads out to go catch him that last little earthworm while the female rests, contented by her lovely gift of you. How thoughtful and yet, how painful. Not for you, though. You've already gone unconcious. At least it wasn't in the morning, or else there'd be some witty comment about the early bird and the worm here.
14121.title: Meet the Mistress' Maw

choices: Hide under the beach towel, and take going undercover to a new low.
Find and make your weapon, you hunter-gatherer you.
14122.content:
For whatever reason, the sparrow has trouble holding you, and the beak releases you from its grip. Luckily, you land not too far from where you had been taken, and walk back there. Once you reach there, you assess your condition: a bit shaken, but other than that, no bodily harm. Sighing in relief, you consider your next move of action.

You have one of two methods of protection you could consider: you can either crawl under your beach towel, or you could explore to try and find and make some sort of weapon. It's your call.
14122.title: Poor Clumsy Sparrow...but lucky you.

141221.content: Hiding under the towel for right now makes you feel safe, but the beach is full of predators and other creatures that could just as easily be your end if you aren't careful. You look around and spot a series of tidal pools in one direction and a dock in the other direction. The dock could have people, but that could be risky given your size and the fact that no one watches where they are going up there. The tidal pools are where people actually look for small things, so you might have a chance of being spotted and saved, but there would definitely be more wildlife there. Where will you go?
141221.title: Hide under the beach towel, and take going unde...

1412211.content: You head for the tidal pool. The journey there is fairly uneventful, save for an encounter with a rather angry hermit crab that chased you halfway here. You look around and guess that the tide has just gone out, so people will be coming in soon, but there will also be an abundance of creatures around as well. Carefully, you make your way to some of the larger pools and sit at the edge to wait. Wondering to yourself where the people have all gone you don't notice as something sneaks up behind you in the water. Once it is too late you look down to see...
1412211.title: Tidal pool

141222.content:
You decide to look for anything usable to make a weapon out of. You've got a feeling that this whole being tiny thing will kill you if you don't take control of the situation quickly. Frankly, you're surprised there are so many animals around. You just never noticed them all before when they weren't trying to kill you.

You decide to search around the place you set up your towel, walking over the sand with some difficulty and pain due to the sand's increased size. But you notice a glowing from under your beach towel, and with effort, remove the towel from what is making the glow. You see, partially buried in the sand, a small red crystal, glowing with weird energy. You get closer, and start to feel bad. You realize you're starting to, very slowly, shrink! You jump away, realizing that sleeping over this is what made you turn tiny. You take a good look at the crystal, and think to yourself....

"Okay, this is too weird this is like something from some kinky fetishist microphile fanfic. A rock that makes you tiny... Okay, there might be a rock like this one that makes me grow to normal somewhere out there. I just need to find it. I mean, everything needs an opposite to balance it, right? Question is, how do I find it?"

You decide to make your weapon, then think more about it. You manage to find some driftwood and make a pole out of a sharp stick, and a few more like it. They could be used to stab giant animals while you search for another glowing crystal that could make you normal size again.

Now, where to go first? Perhaps you could tame a giant animal, or at least get it to carry you on its back or something while you search....
141222.title: Tiny weapons and tiny crystals

1412221.content: You slowly make your way to the water. You take a deep breath before diving straight into it. You start to swim out as quickly as possible to get away from the beach. You start to regret your decision after you get a quarter of a mile off shore. You can’t swim back, you’d drown since you are so tired. You hope that some animal will save you instead of kill you and you keep on swimming. You look down and see a large shadow below you. You start to get really scared and try to swim away as the shadow gets larger. You then feel something hit you from below and you raise out of the water on some sort of creature’s head. What animal is it?
1412221.title: You head to the water

choices: ...stand there in hopes that someone might actually come?
142.content: It was a day at the beach that would turn out to be unlike any other. The wind blows a soft breeze in your face as you arrive, the calling of the gulls above relax you, and everything appears to be perfect. The one beach spot on the coastline where NOBODY was there to take up space. When you said you wanted a vacation alone, you were very surprised by this tiny little beach. You take off your shirt, put on some suntan lotion, and lie down, ready to catch some sun and maybe later, a bit of fun as well. Not much time passes before the serenity of the scene takes you away into deep slumber. Some amount of time passes, and you finally awaken...but what's this? Everything seems quite a bit bigger now. You have no recollection of ever owning a giant suntan lotion bottle. It looks like something happened while you slept, and have been taken down to just 3 measly inches. Suddenly, those gulls calling out above just don't seem that peaceful. In fact, everything appears a bit more hostile at your diminished stature. Not one to panic yet, you realize that you're still alone, and your clothing managed to shrink with you...then you panic. But what to do? It's your call. Will you...
142.title: Not Your Average Day at the Beach

1421.content:
You decide to take a mad dash towards the water for whatever reason. The gulls above don't seem to be paying you any attention, and you dash across the white sand without any incident. You narrowly avoid the lapping tide, which may pull you out to sea if you're not careful. The ebb and flow of the tide is almost hypnotic to watch from a much smaller scale. Careful to keep an eye out for anything much bigger than you, you think carefully on your next action. The water looks tempting, and nothing could possibly see you swimming along. The tide's effect is very calming, and sort of gives you a small hope that you'll return to normal size.

So, will you...
1421.title: Run!! To the Shoreline!!

choices: Or perhaps a friendly, playful dolphin?
14211.content:
Definitely against the idea of a swim (who knows what the heck could be out there?!), you decide to sit aspell and continue to observe the tide's pattern.

Ever ebbing...

Ever flowing...

You gain an overall calm throughout your being. Now THIS is what you vacationed for. Work, school, or whatever it was that you did seemed to wash away with the tide, and everything was just so...peaceful.

Now, a few minutes later, something has to happen...and it does. Suddenly, something's making its way to the shoreline, and towards you! ...what is it, anyway?
14211.title: Calm before the Storm

142111.content:
A cute and adorable seal, no matter what its size, is pretty dangerous to you at this point. You're a tad bit slow to realize this.

Being three inches tall, the seal almost lumbers right over you. It passes your side, but turns back to look at you. Your sense of safety sinks when you hear its massive gut grumble at you. The seal sinks its head down and takes a quick sniff over your body before quickly taking you into its mouth, shuffling you around on its tongue a bit as it tastes you. It quickly gulps you down with one quick contraction of the throat, and you slides down to its gut. The sound wasn't deceptive: this was a HUGE gut. Well, it certainly seemed like it, from your point of view. It had an air about it that was most repulsing, that of dead fish. Accepting this odd fate, you lie down and find the seal's movements to have quite the funny effect on your new home as you're whipped around for a bit. The seal settles down, and you settle down as well. A lack of oxygen takes your conciousness, and the seal begins to digest you. You feel nothing at the luxury of eternal sleep. As for this odd vacation, you find that this is indeed...
142111.title: "Seal"ing your Fate

142112.content:
Friendly and playful dolphins, no matter what their size, are definitely a threat to you at your size. Too bad you're not that quick thinking to realize such a thing.

One of the common methods of hunting food for dolphins is to chase fish all the way up to the shoreline and beach themselves, and when the hapless fish reach this point, they're usually flopping around and make an easy meal for the dolphin, who is simply dragged back out to sea by the tide. Interesting fact, no? Now, back to the story...

The dolphin apporached, beaching itself right by you while several fish flop around you and past you. It appears as if you'll be the dolphin's easy target this time. It clamps its jaws around you, trapping you within the grip of its jaw. The teeth don't cut you, and are actually sort of just keping you in its grip. The tide flows and ebbs once again, bring the dolphin and you out to the sea. You breathe in one last gulp of air before you are doused in water. The dolphin takes you out a ways and finally begins to eat you. It uses its jaws to pull you in onto the tongue, which quickly and mercilessly begins to take you back towards the throat. With one quick gulp, he sends you into the throat, whose muscles pull you down quickly and efficiently. Seconds later, you find yourself trapped in a squishy room reeking of rotted fish. You quickly adjust to the feeling of traveling with the dolphin, whose body movement moves you to and fro in its belly which would almost be as peaceful as the tide if it weren't for the fact that you were doomed now. Finally, sleep take ahold of your body, and the dolphin also takes your body through a now painless digestion. You sleep, the dolphin digests, and for your vacation, this will ultimately be...
142112.title: The Doom of the Dolphin

14212.content:
Despite what peace the current brings in, you're more the type to go out for a swim. You get up and start in on the water, attempting to swim out as far as you can. While you're basically at the mercy of the current, you manage to get some swim on. Finally, you reach a fairly lonely section. Now that you're here, I'd just like to take the time to tell you that there's no going back. The current will only drag you out if you attempt to go back in. So, you're pretty much stuck out in the water.

The pounding of the surf on the surface is still audible, and below you is a vast world of, well, water. It's teeming with life...not like that's a bad thing, right? ...RIGHT?

Now that you're out here, what will you do next?
14212.title: Out for a Swim?

choices: Gotta go deeper, AVOID THE SHARK!!
142121.content:
You kick up your feet and begin descending into the open ocean. As you move down deeper, you realize just how much bigger the ocean looks from down there. Fish dart aimlessly about you, and lucky for you, they don't appear to notice your presence. Big, beautiful fish do eye you up...but only for curiousity's sake. Most of these guys are herbivores, plucking at the fauna.

So, not only have you managed to take in a new perspective on things, you've observed some large fish from a great view, truly observing their patterns and behavior. Go you.

You go up for a large gulp of air, and go down again, hoping to keep watching the fish feed. Things don't always go how one plans them, and this case is no exception. As you head down again, you notice your 'big' friends scattering about you, one nudging you a bit as it scatters. You look on and find a now humongous, threatening shark speeding towards, well, who else but you? Threatened again, you quickly decide you next course of action...
142121.title: Taking the Plunge

choices: Get to the cave, that'll shelter you!
... (Fear, adrenaline, and a lack of oxygen appears to have paralyzed your thoug
1421211.content:
Thinking quickly (which is rather unusual for you, but adrenaline's doing the work), you swim quickly and erraticly to avoid the incoming danger. It works, and the shark passes by above you, dragging you in a small water current for a bit. Still swimming, you come to a point near the bottom near a fairly large cave. You outwitted the shark! Go you...again! There isn't much time to celebrate as you realize your situation now.

A sea snake effortlessly glides through the water. Sadly for you, this sea snake happens to be gliding in your direction. Maybe it's the adrenaline or your lack of oxygen, but that thing sure does have a murderous intent in its beady little eyes. Quickly! There's not much time left for you to make a decision!
1421211.title: Going In Deeper Than You Think

14212111.content:
Once again, you manage that quick thinking (on a roll, I see!) and swim into the cave. You look out to see the sea snake just glide by the cave, but speeding up as it goes by the cave. Perhaps it wasn't that hungry after all, you figure. You feel a bit light-headed now as your brain begins to lack oxygen. As you begin to exit the cave, you quickly realize that the lack of oxygen may no longer be a problem. Quite suddently, a moray eel finds you as not only an intruder of his humble cave, but also a conviniently placed snack. Jaws snap down, but avoid piercing through you. It takes a gulp, and now you find yourself beginning to travel through a very snake-like throat, contracting and pulling you inward. You don't get much time to observe its belly before you fall into unconciousness due to your lack of oxygen.

The eel finds its new acquaintence quite tasty as it slinks back into its cave. Digestion begins painlessly as the eel finds your body to be just what it needs. Quite the fatal dive trip, I'd say. At least you'll be with it until...
14212111.title: Just Dropping In, Quite Literally

14212112.content:
Some would say you're staring in fear and fascination. However, as the phobia name slips your mind, you have the fear right now, and the sea snake just doesn't have the time or the capacity to tell you what this fear is named. It IS rather hungry, though.

Now gliding towards your seemingly frozen body, it glides by, then above, and finally, down to glomp your head into its mouth and begins swallowing. You're just lucky it thought you were dead, for it could've bit you and injected poison that would've brought death if the bite didn't do that first. It travels with you more slowly now, taking a few gulps to get you within its greedy gut. Your view is of a dark pinkish color, slowly bring you in deeper, and turning your surroundings darker gradually. The rhythmic movements of the swallow finally bring you to the deepest and darkest chambers of the belly, which don't hesitate to bring on the acid. It stings and burns your body, and the pain is so intense that you almost instantly black out, permenantly.

With tiny little belly bulge in tow, the sea snake glides back to it home, content with your contents, and living to hunt another day. You, on the other hand, don't live. Live on, maybe, as a distant memory of a well-digested meal, but for your body, it is...
14212112.title: Princess Sea Snake's Hospitality

1421212.content:
You don't move at all, and you don't think at all. All thoughts are focused on your current peril, and everything seems to spell doom.

Everything seems to move in a sort of slow motion. The shark speeds ominously closer to you, which takes an eternity in your own mind. After what seems like an hour, the shark opens it huge jaw and sucks you into its mouth. Those serrated, razor-sharp teeth manage to miss you, but this doesn't help the fact that you've just been taken in whole by a shark. The water rushes through its gills, but you're gulped into its throat. That tight squeeze of a throat seems to crush you as you pass through, and finally, you're truly within the belly of a beast. You've likely imagined being eaten by a shark, but never would you think it'd happen with you surviving in its gut. The belly reeks with the odor of expired fish, but it won't matter for too much longer. You take some time to observe your surroundings, not seeing much but feeling the fish scales and mucus that encompasses you. Energy expiring, you fall asleep inside the belly, and the shark continues on its way, making use of your body for energy by way of digestion. Vacation's over, sorry to say. It is truly...
1421212.title: Shark Bait

142122.content:
You believe that you'd have to be nuts to dive down and get gobbled up by something 3 feet into the water. As such, you stay on the surface. Your hopes are mixed, perhaps someone will swim out here and see a tiny little person to rescue. Or that a chopper will come by, somehow manage to notice you, and have you climb up one of the rungs...no, wait, that's not right at all...but whatever your hopes are, you stay up on the surface.

Ever drifting...drifting away...

We're drifting...

Still drifting...

The current's flow apparently made you really tired, as you've fallen asleep. Waking up, you don't realize what could potentially happen to you. So, when you wake up from this drifting, which way are you going to look first?
142122.title: Treading Water

1421221.content:
Way to go, you optimist you! For as long as anyone could remember, you've been a positive driving force in whatever situations you got involved in. I'm sure that just by going in the water at your size, you were optimistic about finally getting to swim.

I'm sorry to say, but this isn't your day.

You look up, and from a distance (and approaching fast) comes a pelican swooping in with its fascinatingly-shaped pouch of a mouth and scoops you up along with a fairly large sum of water. Before you even got the chance to panic, it took you in. Sad, isn't it? The big bird takes you back to shore with you still sloshing around in its beak. With a tilt the water begins lowering and draining out of its beak. You attempt to get out, but are held back by the beak, which is acting as a filter to filter you out from the water. After most of the water is drained out, the pelican quickly tilts its head back and swallows you down. Peristalic muscles in the throat take you quickly down into its digestive chamber, where the odor of rotting fish, along with a fresh catch still weakly tumbling around, greets you. Your new home is fairly comfortable, and you take to it well, even patting and comforting the fish, as it may be the only thing you have left as you fall victim to a deep and eternal rest.

The pelican, fresh off of a recent meal, begins digesting its catch, gravely starving and grateful for your body's contribution to its survival. You are food now, and nothing more. You life has reached...
1421221.title: Who can? Pelican! Wait, that's not right at al

1421222.content:
You knew something bad would happen. For as long as anyone could remember, you always seemed to be cautious, but not cautiously optimistic. You could always see the bad before the good, and while this has helped you many a time, it won't do you much good now.

As you look down, a shadow starts to form below you and quickly grow. Faster than you could say "Well now, what's that?", a gigantic fish (the type of which you could not discern, even if you wanted to) rises to the occasion and jumps to the surface, taking you in its mouth, then splashes back down. Tasting you but for a short moment, it quickly gulps you down, the throat seeming to want to crush the very life out of you due to its tight fit. After that, you breathe once again as you enter its stomach. You notice the odor of already-digested fishes reeking in its belly, part of which seems to have already taken a liking to you. It squeezes around you, and a tingly feeling begins to emerge around your upper body. Before you could begin to question what this substance was that began to cover you, you fall into a deep and unending slumber as the fish begins to make use of your body...

Well now, don't you wish you would've stayed in bed today?
1421222.title: Fish Guts

1422.content:
You determine that it probably wouldn't be a good idea to dash out towards the water, since you are snack size for anything that has a mouth. You've decided to stick around and wait for help. Another person could've made an appointment to come here, and maybe that same person would be kind enough to help you out. With hope, you begin to wait...

As you wait, seagulls call out from above, and you're made slightly nervous and on-edge. Anything could see you and pick you off now. You somehow remain calm and don't budge. As you sit down and begin to hum a song to yourself, something sparks your attention.

What was that...
1422.title: Your Last Stand?

14221.content:
You decide to turn your attention to the rustling of a nearby bush. As you look on, a seagull knocks you down, but flaps away quickly, seeing something more desirable in the distance. You gather yourself on your towel and look on to find that a marine iguana has emerged from the bush, and is padding its way over to you.

As you observe its approach, you begin to remember a certain class you took about marine biology...in that class, you covered marine reptiles, and this guy was one of them. You also remember that there was this one smart kid who alway asked questions. The one you're focusing memory on was definitely important for where you're at right now...

"Ms. Conway, can marine iguanas eat meat?"
You sighed, thinking that they were exclusively herbivores.
"Well, they do have a nutritional requirement for protein. It's not outside the realm of possibility." the teacher said.

Before you can react, the reptile has already grabbed you. Seeming almost reluctant to eat you, it slowly and teasingly takes you into its slimy mouth. All around you, the tongue quivers, as if it was tasting you. Then, it moves you to the back ofthe mouth and begins to swallow you quite slowly. Your head moves into the throat first, then the rest of your body. It takes a bit, but you finally arrive in its belly. You find the odor of its stomach to be quite plesant, consisting of plant material. You relax, taking in the unique scent of its belly and eventually falling asleep, never to wake up. The lizard has just taken in its protein requirement for the next month, and it couldn't be happier. As for you and your vacation, though, this spells...
14221.title: Lunch for the Lizard

14222.content:
You decide to look back and see what you heard flapping towards you. It doesn't take but a second to realize that a seagull (now gigantic and intimidating to you) has spotted your tiny form and has every intention on gulping you down. It flutters over to you, then quickly captures you in its beak, keeping you there almost teasingly, only further intrigued by the struggles of its catch. Only seconds later does it begin quickly gulping you down, barely giving you the time to say good-bye to the outside world. You hear the clicking of the beak as you slide down its gullet and into a sac one could only describe as the holding place for its food.

From a book you read once as a small child, you remember that this was called the crop. Birds crush and grind their food here before passing it along to the true stomach, which begins to break down the food. The intestine send it the rest of the way.

Remembering this, you cower in fear and attempt to knock yourself out before such a painful process would begin. A couple of hard blows to the head finalizes this, and as the seabird begins to process you, you assure yourself that by knocking yourself out, you only delay what would become...
14222.title: The Gullet of the Gull

143.content: Here are your only to choices...
143.title: last chance

1431.content:
Well this story suffers from small and extra small. Let us fix that:

Do not go to miniature size right away, it makes it boring and irritating, along with becoming a meal every other chapter.
Yes nature is cruel, but you would hope for the main character to live through his shrink experience and perhaps find an ocean friend in the process.

So let us make these sizes:

Feet: from normal size down to one foot,

Inches: From twelve down to 1
1431.title: Size fix

14311.content:
to prevent the minaturization we give you this block chapter for it
So let us list those sizes
14311.title: feet

14312.content: well to give new life to these chapters and to other chapters that ended on all lines with vore and death.
14312.title: inches

choices: a down (rabbits, hares, mice, seagulls, etc...)
a hilly terrain (goats, hedgehogs, moles, etc...)
15.content: Maybe these might tickle your fancy.
15.title: Further Locations

151.content: The protagonist is a human, how small should he be?
151.title: What Size

1511.content:
You find your way to an area of downland not too uncommon to the area. Staring upon a water-bordered land, every inch looks lush and grand, even if it was mostly chalky going into the sea. Looking past the chalky areas, you see a lush green overhang with a single tree dotting the western end. Animals scamper about unseen in the tall grass and fly through the air. As you're marvelling at the surroundings, you feel a bit faint. The smell of marigolds are the last thing you recall before falling unconcious...

An unknown amount of time passes before you finally awaken. As you peer around, everything seems an awful lot bigger than it was. A blade of grass is now about 3 times bigger than you are. With no explaination of what happened, you reason that in order to enjoy the rest of your getaway, you must find a way to get back to normal size.

A path, which looks like it was made by the wheels of a car, lays to both your left and right. You take...
1511.title: On Your Way

15111.content:
You take the left path. Both paths are relatively the same, but the left looked more appealing at the time anyhow. The plowed-down grass makes for easy travel. Just what you're trying to find isn't clear, but you remember a scent of something or other before you passed out...

Soaring high in the sky above you, a large avian momentarily blocks out the sunlight as its giant shadow passing over you. As you look up and shield your eyes from the sun, you notice its form is circling above, seeming to have picked out a target. You look both ways to find the hapless prey item it selected before realizing that you're the only thing it could probably seen. You look back up to now find the shape quickly approaching you. No time to react now! The eagle...
15111.title: Just Wingin' It

choices: ...a large nest with an eaglet, maw gaping.
151111.content:
The eagle is one of the most efficient birds-of-prey. With its razor-sharp eyes, it's able to spy you from many feet above. With wings both broad and even, it soars inconspicuously above. Now, you're going to find out just how powerful the talons are.

At speeds barely comprehendible, it siezes your tiny form with gigantic claws which narrowly miss cutting into your delicate body. The bird clings to you as you cling to it, ascending quickly. Being such a small prey item, the bird's grip isn't as tight as it would be on something larger. Letting go now, the equivelant of an eight hundred foot drop, would result in the splatter of you on the ground. You decide to play along and see where it's taking you. As the tree comes into you, you spy...
151111.title: Vice-gripped! Sort of...

choices: ...recall an animal psychology course you took.
...attempt a daring escape sans a stunt double.
1511111.content:
You look on in almost complete dread at the nest before you. Inside, an eaglet peers out to see a returning parent with a choicy bit of meat. Another thought occurs to you all at once: the grip on you was loosened for the eaglet. Indeed, today's training day for the young avian, and you're to be the target. Your faint struggles only assure the parent that you're still alive.

As you arrive, you are promptly dropped before the eaglet. The parent takes a perch that lay just a few inches from the broad nest. You search out an escape route, but find none. You then look forward, meeting your match. Instinctively, you find the eaglet to be somewhat adorable. It bore larger eyes than those of an adult, but only slightly larger ones. Its beak and talons are smaller as well, but both still make fine weapons.

The eaglet approaches you. You can swear you justh eard the sort of belly grumble that a starved man would have. It hasn't eaten in a day. Suddenly, you...
1511111.title: The Eaglet - Adorable and Avaricious

15111111.content:
In a bout of mental power, you suddenly recall a course you took at school. It dealt with animal psychology, and was likely your favorite course. In particular, your memory focuses on a lesson in animal attack psychosis. In a flash of inspiration, you look to the eagle and shout "STOP!" Intimidated slightly, the eaglet hops back, startled.

"I know why you want to attack," you begin. "I can understand the hunger you feel. However, I've taken some courses in psychology, and if you want to talk about it, I can help you," you assure. "We are both one and the same. Let's -- YAARGH!"

The eaglet grew tired of listening, as had the parent. Clutching you in its beak, it quickly gobbles you down. You slip down its throat with ease and land in its belly a moment later. You look about, not seeing too much in the darkness. The belly grumbles happily around you as it kneads you, already pouring hot liquids into the stomach. They lull you into a deep sleep, only slightly tingling as you recall one last memory before permanent unconciousness: the fourty-six out of one hundred you scored on the final exam in that class.
15111111.title: The Final Exam

15111112.content:
In a bout of frantic mental energy, you suddenly recall a car chase stunt from your favorite movie.

The protagonist jumps clear of the and lands on a pile of conviniently placed spring mattresses as the car plows into a gasoline truck, which explodes. The explosion reacts with unseen methane, which makes the explosion larger. The upgraded explosion reacts with a fire-breathing dragon in the air, which also explodes. The camera pans back to the protaganist, who ends the movie with an anecdote:

"If it weren't for that horse, I wouldn't have spent those four years in college."

You loved that movie, but now hate the situation that you're in. As the eaglet goes for you, you scamper up to the top of the rim of the nest and then jump off. Unfortunately for you, the eagle never left. It plucks you from the air and throws you back in. The eaglet catches you in its beak, taking you in eagerly. Its slick, blobby tongue glances you as you slide into its throat. You then slip into its belly, looking about with a little bit of regret. You final thought before slipping into unconciousness is something about needing a stunt double. Luckily, your bad pun is cut off by the kneading stomach and its acids.
15111112.title: Aaand...ACTION!

choices: ...attempt to scramble out the top of the nest.
...go through the bottom of the nest.
1511112.content: You look on and feel very intimidated. The nest that the eagle drops you into is large and empty. Supported by a foundation of twigs, sticks, leaves, and other nearly indescernable objects, you can only wonder for a few moments what the eagle has in store for you. It hops into the nest, inspecting you once more. The piercing gaze turns your legs into Jello, and you're about ready to accept your fate. Only the flap of another pair of wings saves you for the moment. The eagle looks outward and slowly towards another eagle landing in the nest. You can't quite tell from your current view, but the other eagle seems smaller than your captor. The factoid doesn't change the fact that you're now surrounded by two hungry birds-of-prey. Big, hungry birds-of-prey. Without thinking, you...
1511112.title: To the Nest Comes Trouble

15111121.content:
You attempt to scramble to the top of the nest, obviously planning to jump off the tree. What makes you think this? The jacket you're wearing could, in theory, be opened and spread out much like the gliding squirrels that go from tree to tree. You've always wanted one of those as a pet.

When you reach the top, you neglect to think that the eagles could potentially grab you. Hmm.

And grab you they do. In fact, both of them grab you at once. One eagle has one end of you, and one eagle has the other end. You writhe and shout in panic, squirming futily.

The last thing you can see is the interior of one of the eagles' maws. Your body is quickly stretched, then torn apart by the two eagles. It's quick, relatively painless, and fufilling for both eagles' wants. If you were any bigger than what you were, it would be considered a grim spectacle to any possible onlookers. There being none but the eagles themselves, it can only be considered cute that the male would share with the female. Awwww.
15111121.title: Torn Apart...

15111122.content:
You scramble out through the bottom of the nest, digging your way through the nest's many materials. Try as they might, the eagles cannot seem to pluck you out, through one does get at your leg. It really hurts, but you manage to make it out just fine. You peek out from your hiding spot when you hear the flap of wings. Both the eagles have given up on you and have gone to find something else to eat.

Hopping out of the nest, the branch you're on is thick and insect-free (much to your relief). Looking up, you notice that the tree towers upward with a city-esque structure of branches branching outward. You then look downward, and decide not to do that again. The height is still as dizzying as it was when you were in flight with the eagle.

In the absence of a tiny elevator to take you either up or down, it appears as if you'll have to make the journey yourself.
15111122.title: Escaping Both Eagles

151111221.content:
You notice the Eagles are still flying above you, circling around the tree. If you stay were you are for too long, you will be eaten for sure. You decide that climbing down would be too predictable, so you climb up. Those eagles won't see that coming.

It turns out that your stupidity actually did manage to save you fro. The eagles, but now you find yourself I the claws of...
151111221.title: Climb farther up the tree.

1511112211.content:
The black scales of a bird's talons wrap around your body. They were tight, but not as tight as the eagle's. You look up to see that you captor is black, with patches of white on him. A clever magpie. You try to wiggle your way out of his talons, but he just tightens his grip on you. You look ahead to see a small oak tree. The magpie releases one of this talons so he can grip a branch. The foot he uses to hold you raises up to his beak. He's going to eat you.

When the magpie grips you with his beak, he lets go with his foot. With two feet griping the branch he landed on, he lifts his beak up and you descend into his gullet. You forget trying to struggle. If you do manage to get away, another bird will catch you and try to eat you. You might as well end the cycle now.

The magpie lowers his head again just to wip it back up to force you deeper into his gullet. The world grows darker than the magpies beak because it closes, making you a thing of the past. Nothing but food for a intelligent bird. The bird continues to wip it's head up and down until gravity takes over to carry you past the crop and into his stomach. Although the magpie may not be as smart as a human, he was smart enough to know humans were smarter than him. And he was intelligent enough to feel the pleasure of utterly dominating a "superior" organism.

You find yourself in the stomach of the magpie. It was dark, hot, and slimy, just as you would expect it to be. The tingling sensation of the acids were already upon you. For a few minutes you struggle to keep your mind off of the burning, but the magpie's digestive system has something else in mind. You feel like you are swallowed again as the stomach pushes you out of it and deeper into digestion. To the gizzard you go.

Once you enter the gizzard, it wastes no time grinding you up. The combination of muscle and stone render you unconsience within 2 painful minutes. And within 30. a nutritional pulp to be absorbed by the intestines.

All the magpie can think about is where to find more small humans like you were. All he though about was how pleasureful it was to turn a human into food, not that a creature with more knowledge and experience than he was rendered into nutreince for a "lesser" organism. But you where not just turned into nutrition, as the magpie relieves itself you you in the form of bird poop, you also turned into just that. Bird poop.
1511112211.title: A magpie's meal

151111222.content:
Despite the aching pain in your leg, you decide to descend from the tree. You figure that at the base of the tree, someone's bound to notice your diminished stature.

You find a sturdy piece of bark to hold as you begin to climb down from the base of the branch. Nothing takes notice of you...yet. Your leg slips a couple of times, but you manage to retain your balance.

After fifteen minutes of going down, you notice a knothole at the equivelant of fifty feet below. It doesn't appear occupied, and it will give you a moment to rest. It may also provide protection against other tree-dwellers.
151111222.title: Down the tree you go

choices: Attempt to shoo the squirrel away.
1511112221.content:
Craving rest and wanting to devise some sort of plan while doing so, you decide to slip into the knothole. It takes some rough steps and near missteps, but you make it in intact.

The hole is dark and warm on the inside. With no source of lighting other than the sunlight beaming in, you find a place outside of view and sit down. You closely examine the pecked leg. While badly bruised and sort of swollen, you can't find anything else wrong with it, to your relief.

As you get comfortable, some excited chittering gets your heart racing. From further down this knothole, a squirrel emerges. Its tail twitches as the beady eyes take sight of you. It edges closer for further inspection, sniffing audibly at the new guest in its prescence. Normally, a squirrel such as this one would flee at the sight of you. This one, however, is around five to six times your size.

There's no rest for the weary here. As the squirrel investigates you, you...
1511112221.title: You're an intruder!

choices: The squirrel seems to realize you're in pain
The squirrel gets angry at the noise you make....
15111122211.content:
You stay there, shouting at the squirrel and trying to make yourself seem bigger and tougher than you actually are at your current size. The squirrel actually takes a step back in surprise. Unfortunately for you, it seems to realize that this small animal isn't much of a threat. It slowly approaches you again, and then, so quickly it's like a blur, its paws shoot at you. You're gripped tightly between the giant squirrel's paws, your arms pinned to your sides and your legs feebly kicking the air. The squirrel plucks you off the ground easily, and holds you away from itself, looking you over. It moves its head in and sniffs you, the suction actually tugging at your shirt.

You're shouting for it to let you go as if examines you, and the squirrel seems to get annoyed. It drops you, and you fall about the equivalent of fifteen feet. You lie on the ground in pain, shouting again, this time due to your injuries. The leg that the eagle hurt is now even worse....
15111122211.title: Don't make a giant squirrel angry....

choices: Stay with her and try to pass the time somehow until you heal up
Get her to help you as you search for a way to get to normal size
151111222111.content:
Somehow, the squirrel seems to realize that it hurt you, and it gets down on all fours to examine you closer to tell just how bad. You lie there, expecting it to eat you or something, but you're surprised when the squirrel starts nuzzling you. You keep still, but realize it is trying to make you feel better. You stay still for a bit, and eventually get to the point where you feel okay to stand up. You stand up, using the squirrel for support, and can't help but steal a glance towards its crotch to tell its gender. From what you see, or rather cannot see, you presume the squirrel is a female, and perhaps is just resorting to its feminine gentleness to help a small creature in need. You look up at the squirrel's Brady steam which have been watching you all this time, and thank her. The squirrel doesn't understand, of course, but makes squeaking sounds in reply anyway.

So, now you're slowly healing, and you have a giant friendly squirrel girl. Now what?
151111222111.title: Luckily, this squirrel is nice

choices: You reach where you first shrunk
1511112221112.content:
You decide to see just how helpful the squirrel is willing to be to you. You walk behind spher, and she watches you with her beady eyes. You look at her tall back, and ask her if you can climb onto her. Obviously, she can't reply, and can't understand you. Even so, you jump at her back, grabbing her short fur and clambering up to her shoulders.

She seems to dislike that, and bucks you off easily. You hit the side of the wooden room, sliding down the wall in pain. The squirrel walks over to you, but you notice she seems concerned. She picks you up again, holding you between her paws like a nut of some kind, and, making a movement you didn't know squirrels could, places you on her shoulders. You think she realizes she hurt you, and knows you weren't trying to hurt her. You cling to her back, and she walks out of the tree and into the sun. She scampers down the trunk, and you barely hold on. After reaching the ground, she looks in all directions and starts running one way.
1511112221112.title: Squirrel rider

choices: You reach a tunnel in the dirt
15111122211121.content:
You hang onto the sauirrel bouncing up and down as she runs along the ground at surprising speeds. After some time, she stops, and you take a look around, realizing that the landscape is familiar. Somehow, the squirrel has brought you to where you shrunk at the start of this whole mess.

You notice a red glow from in the grass, and direct the squirrel to it. You take a moment to marvel at how you're actually controlling the giant squirrel, impressed that she is even capable of understanding your orders of yanking her fur like that. You reach the glow's source, and see a weird red crystal. The squirrel seems afraid of it, but also growls slightly at it. It's a cute sound, though, and isn't so intimidating, even though the squirrel is huge to you. You ask if the squirrel recognizes it, and she squeaks, as if she understand you. Then, she suddenly darts off, almost shaking you loose as she runs into a patch of taller grass....
15111122211121.title: You reach where you first shrunk

choices: She wants to keep you, and doesn't want you leaving
She just wants to help.... Right?
151111222111211.content:
The squirrel keeps running, and then suddenly, you're underground. She ran into a tunnel, and is continuing down it with you still clinging to her. Eventually, she stops in a cave with a very high ceiling, big enough for you to stand in at normal height. Theres a second entrance, conveniently also big enough for a human to fit through, and you wonder if you could escape throught hat should you grow to normal here. You notice a small blue glowing crystal in its center, and realize the squirrel probably brought you here due to the similarities between the crystal she just saw and this one, which she likely had found already.

You dismount your cute and not so mighty steed, walking towards the crystal. But before you get far, you feel a familiar tightness around your body, and your feet leave the ground. You look up and a bit backwards, and see that the squirrel has again snatched you in her paws, and is looking at you with a weird look....
151111222111211.title: You reach a tunnel in the dirt

choices: The squirrel tries to save you!
You try to avoid it yourself!
1511112221112112.content:
Luckily, it seems the squirrel just wants to help. She begins walki ton her hind legs, making a skipping motion that is much faster than you could have walked, and you reach the crystal soon. But it's not over yet, because as the squirrel sets you down, you see the glint of something from outside the cave. Through the big entrance steps an eagle, the same one from before it seems. The eagle looks angry, and hungry too, and makes a loud cawing sound at you and the squirrel. The squirrel squeaks in fear, but seems too paralyzed to run. You look back at her, then at the approaching eagle, and decide that now is a good time to touch that crystal and see what happens.

Hoping you'll reach it in time, you turn and run towards it. But you're surprised when the eagle slams into the ground right between you and the crystal, having leapt over you with the aid of its wings. For some reason, it sees you as a better target than the squirrel, and it's open beak shoots down towards you....
1511112221112112.title: She just wants to help.... Right?

15111122211121122.content:
You dive forward, scraping yourself on the stone ground as the eagle's strong beak snaps shut behind you. You scramble to your feet, and run between it's legs, lunging for the crystal. The eagle is too slow to react, and too stunned at your speed, and you can reach the crystal!

A flash of white, and then your vision returns. You're human size again, and the eagle squawks in surprise and flies out of the small cave. You glance around and see the squirrel. Now surprisingly tiny, and she squeaks a bit. You know it may be a bad idea, but you hold out your hand for her to sniff. She recognizes the smell, but is intimidated by your size and backs away. You look back at the crystal and see that it's grown dim, so you decide to leave.

As you leave, you feel something climb up your back. You look and see the squirrel sitting on your shoulder. Her beady eyes stare into your own eyes, and she squeaks. You're again impressed by the squirrel's intelligence, and figure she could be wanting more than food from you, seeing as you're a human and squirrels seem to always take the food you guys provide for birds and the like. Perhaps the little squirrel wants companionship.

You smile, and begin to walk home. As you reach your house, you wonder what you've gotten yourself into. You're not even sure squirrels are legal pets, but as the little furry animal falls asleep on your shoulder, you can't help but note how docile this particular one seems. You're not tiny anymore, and now that you've overcome that challenge, keeping a pet squirrel seems easy.

You still fear that she might turn feral again and try and bite you all over, but you decide to look past that. You hope that this new squirrel friend of yours will be a good companion for you, as quirky as your adventure as a tiny was.

(Please note, the author does not condone keeping squirrels as pets, unless you have shrunken and determined that one is highly intelligent and docile and willing to be tamed. Squirrels can be insane, and are dangerous even to an ordinary sized human. Thank you)
15111122211121122.title: Dodge the eagle, and achieve victory!

15111122212.content:
There is no rest for the weary, you figure, and despite the pain in your leg, you decide to continue moving down the tree. The squirrel flicks its tail and chitters, as if to say, "and STAY out!"

The bark is flimsy at best. Pieces break off randomly as you struggle to keep your hold on the tree. A fall from here could spell your doom. You watch as the eagle takes off again, in search of something easier to eat.

Nearing the bottom now, you let your guard down and end up toppling from a point which is, at your scale, 50 feet from the ground. Dirt cushions your landing, and pain shoots through your leg for a short time before dissipating. As you get up and turn around, you back up against the tree as a creature trots over to get a better look at you. It's a...
15111122212.title: Keep Moving Downward

choices: You dodge, and then something rescues you... But is it helpful?
The vixen grabs you!  But will she eat you?
151111222121.content:
You see a fox slowly approaching you, watching you carefully. You stand still, feeling upset. Youve already had to deal with enough giant animals. How many more until you can get back to normal size?

You feel a wave of strength wash over you, and you decide to face the fox defiantly. You walk right at it (taking a moment to glance at the tell-tale gender identification area between its back legs and determining that the fox is female, or a vixen as they are also known), and stand up straight. The vixen eyes you curiously, and then crouches down. She sniffs at you, the force sucking your shirt towards her nose. It frightens you, but you've already encountered a giant eagle and squirrel, and the first of those was carnivorous, so you feel like you can take on this carnivore too.

You realize how foolish that really sounds as the vixen opens her mouth, drool dripping from it and strands of saliva running from the ceiling to the tongue. Her sharp teeth glint, and her hot breath hits you hard....
151111222121.title: The vixen

choices: Another, bigger female fox, presumably her older sister
1511112221212.content:
You stand there, frozen with fear, as the vixen moves her maw towards you. When she gets close, her tongue sticks out and loops behind you, and you get quickly drawn into her gaping maw by the powerful muscle. You try to get up and jump out, but the vixen slams her jaws shut, trapping you inside her maw.

You sit on total darkness, surprised she didn't try to chew you. You have a bad feeling she's saving you for something else worse, though. You can feel the vixen running quickly, and you get tossed around in her maw. Her tongue is soft, but her teeth are hard enough to hurt you, and you just want to get out of her mouth.

Suddenly, light returns, and you get spat out. You lie on the ground, covered in vixen drool, and slowly get to your feet. You look up and see the vixen walking away, deeper into what looks like a small cave. She comes back shortly, bringing with her....
1511112221212.title: The vixen grabs you

choices: She steps back, and the bigger one licks her lips....
The smaller one grabs you again, and carries you back outside
15111122212122.content: A second vixen follows the one that had grabbed you, and you presume they are sisters due to similar coloring and little size difference. The first seems excited, but the new bigger one seems less so. The first walks over to you and stands over you, keeping you between her front legs and panting. The bigger vixen looks at you, though, and makes growling noises towards the first. The jest one looks down at you with a strangely sad expression, and you wonder what is happening....
15111122212122.title: Two vixens

151111222121221.content: The bigger fox's stomach growls signifying that she is hungry... And your on the menu. With that she opens her maw and quickly snaps you up. Her teeth narrowly miss as you move to the throat. Struggling you try to grasp the tongue but its too slick to latch on to. With a single strong pull of the throat muscles tou are dragged into the throat and into darkness.
151111222121221.title: Fox food

choices: You manage to hitch a ride on something....
Something else decides to take you
151111222121222.content:
You don't have to wonder long, because the smaller an younger vixen suddenly leans down and snatches you up in her maw again. It's still a frightening experience, and you still instinctively struggle. But it's only a few minutes until you're out, back outside the cave. The vixen makes a quiet growl at you and leaves.

You give up on wiping the drool off and decide to try and head back to where this all started, hoping to end it by growing to normal size again....
151111222121222.title: Leaving the vixens the way you came

1511112221212221.content:
Wondering why the vixens spared you, and putting it down to your unfamiliarity and bad taste to them, you keep walking. You soon realize that it would bewaytootough to try and get back to where you first shrunk by going on foot, so you decide to keep an eye out for more giant animals, hoping to catch a ride on one.

You walk into a patch of tall grass that is bigger than you, walking slowly and listening for animals, when you suddenly pass into an area of shorter grass, so short that you can see where you are. you realize that this must be an area where wild animals are grazing, and wonder if you should try and get on one, or hop back to the tall grass and wait for another animal to pass by....
1511112221212221.title: Grazers were here

choices: Try and get on the cow
Let her pass and try a different animal
15111122212122211.content: You step into the shorter grass, and star to hear a bell clanging. After a moment, you pinpoint the source as a cow, wearing a bell around her neck. You gaze at her enormous size, surprised because its the largest animal you've seen yet, but decide to get out of her way. You notice her tail hanging low, and twitching a few times, and figure you might beagle to get on her back by climbing it....
15111122212122211.title: Cow incoming

choices: You see a young human girl approaching
You see a single wolf approaching and eyeing the cow
151111222121222111.content:
You run towards the cow, making sure to stay away enough that she doesn't notice you. You're so small compared to her, she doesn't even notice you. You sneak around back and reach her tail, and jump up, grabbing it in your hands.

The cow seems to notice this, though, and she flicks her tail. You get thrown around, but cling onto her tail tightly, surprised by your own strength. But you lose your grip when the cow slams her tail, and you, onto the top of her rump. You fall off, lying on her tan hide in pain. She just keeps grazing.

You manage to stand up soon, and look around yourself. You're so high up, a fall could kill you many times over. The cow still doesn't notice you on her back, even when you walk towards her head. You reach her shoulders, and decide to sit down and stop there. You wait as the cow grazes, and though she moves slowly, you know it's faster than walking.

You consider what the cows bell means, though, and wonder if there are people nearby. You keep thinking that when...
151111222121222111.title: Try and get on the cow

choices: Stay low and she might pass you....
She comes straight to the cow you're on!
1511112221212221111.content: Sitting on the cow's back, you notice a young girl walking towards the cow, and therefore you as well. You think she would be helpful if you could get her attention, but she looks like she's not even ten years old yet, so she might just take you as a toy. You look at her short sandy hair done in a ponytail, her freckled face with bright blue eyes, and her clothing, consisting of a white shirt with blue coveralls above it and covering her legs. Looking at her, the only reaction you feel is fear, mixed with hope, and you wonder if you should try and get her attention....
1511112221212221111.title: Cowgirl child

15111122212122211112.content:
The young farmer girl comes straight to the cow you're on, and there's nowhere to hide. So, you decide to stand up tall and shout at her.

"Hey!" you shout. "Down here!"

The girl stops, looking around for the source of the sound before noticing you. She gives a quiet yelp and jumps back, and you keep shouting up at her.

"Don't be afraid," you say. "I need your help! I got shrunk somehow and now I need to figure out how to turn back to normal! Can you help me?"

The farmer girl walks up to the cow again. You notice that the cow is even bigger than she is, and she has to stand on a wooden stool she conveniently brought (likely planning to bring the cow back to her barn and milk her while sitting on the stool) to look at you.

"Wow," she breathes. "You're so tiny! What appended to you?"

"I'm not sure," you say. "But I don't like it, so do you think you could help me?"

The girl looks at you curiously, her head tilted to the side. Her blue eyes analyze you, and you get a little frightened by how instantly she watches you. But then, her hands come up, and one rest on the cow while the other moves towards you.

"Hey, wait!" you shout, stepping back. "What are you doing?"

You know what she's doing, of course. You're unable to resist as her hand reaches you, and she snatches you up, her fingers wrapping around your tiny body and holding you tightly. She easily plucks you off the cows back and steps off the stool, bringing you within inches of her face.

She looks at you for a few seconds. You just dangle there, her hand enclosing your body from armpit down....
15111122212122211112.title: Giant farmer girl notices you....

choices: The girl will tell you approximately where the magic animal is, who can grow you
She decides she'll leave you at the barn and do some research on the crystal
151111222121222111121.content:
The girl smiles gently, lifting up her other hand to pat your head.

"Aw, don't worry little guy," she says. "I'll help you. What do you need me to do?"

You breathe a sigh of relief, and tell her you want to go back to sphere all this started. You give her directions based on where you think you are, and she seems to recognize the place.

"Oh, you went there?" she asks. "Nobody ever goes there... They say there's bad magic there."

"Yeah, I figured," you mutter. You're being held by a giant young farmer girl after all, what looks like many feet above the ground. You can't say it's enjoyable, and you ask her what is known about the bad magic.

"Well, it's a magic that makes people super weak," she explains, "but I've never known just what it does. I guess it actually shrinks them?"

"Guess so," you say. "Is there any antidote?"

"We do have some legends about a certain animal that knows how to reverse that bad magic," the girl says. "I'm not sure exactly where it lives, though, but if it comes down to it, I might be able to tell you vaguely...."

You sigh, and tell the girl to just take you to the "bad magic place". She agrees, reluctantly, and starts carrying you towards a barn you can see in the distance. She enters it and mounts a small horse, holding you tightly in her hand, and begins riding the horse quickly.

You reach the place you first shrunk, and are hit with the smell of flowers from before, but his time, the smell is putrid. He girl dismounts, holding her nose with the hand not holding you, and you both look around.

"There!" you shout, pointing at a glowing spot on the ground. The girl crouches down before jumping back with a shout.

"Oh no!" she says. "I guess that bad magic really does exist! See, it's some kind of crystal! I've never seen that before... Maybe it shrunk you?"

You both notice how the stone is glowing dimly, and seems to be on the verge of stopping altogether. The girl refuses to get near it, and holds you up to her face again.

"Okay, little guy," she says. "I've got an idea...."
151111222121222111121.title: A weird crystal

choices: Not with that owl watching!  Get back in the cage before it gets you!
Might as well risk it... You'll die of boredom otherwise.
1511112221212221111212.content:
The girl decides to leave you at the barn her family runs, and do some research on the animal that could help you. She rides the horse back, and leaves you in a small cage inside the barn. She explains it was once for pet rats, but they haven't kept any in a while. She says hell be safe in it, thou, and leaves, promising to return soon.

You sit in the cage, and quickly get bored. You also feel it's degrading to be treated like a pet rat, and decide to get out for a bit. You open the cage door with some difficulty, and look around the barn. You see a cow and bull lying near each other, a horse foal sleeping on the ground, a few sheep wandering around, and in the rafters, a barn owl.

Should you examine any of them closer, you ask yourself?
1511112221212221111212.title: Barn animals

choices: It decides you look like food!
It hoots and leaves you alone.
15111122212122211112121.content: You eye the owl carefully, and it ruffles it's feathers. You start to panic, and decide to get back in the rat cage. But you've only had enough time to struggle with the cage door trying to close it when the owl suddenly lands on the table in front of your cage. You keep trying to close the gate, but the owl raises a songle talon and grasps the door bars in it. You get yanked with the door as the owl pulls it open, and you tumble to the table between the owl's legs. The owl steps back and eyes you curiously, tilting its head a little as its yellow eyes pierce into you....
15111122212122211112121.title: Barn owl attack!  Kind of...

choices: The girl returns in time to help
Theres no escape from the owl
151111222121222111121211.content: Sadly, the owl seems to think you're a rat, as you were in the rat cage. It spreads it's wings wide, and starts flapping them. You almost get blown away by the force of the wind, but the owl won't let you escape. It raises a single talon and quickly stomps on your tiny body. You shout in pain as it presses you into the table, but it doesn't keep that up for long. It soon curls it's toes around your body, siezing you in its talon and raising you up until you're held close to its odd, then it takes off and shoots to the rafters again. You're dizzy from the flight, and the owl drops you in front of it. You stagger to your feet, balancing on the rafter and backing away as the owl advances on you, pecking towards you a few times and seeming to want to play with you before eating you....
151111222121222111121211.title: It decides you look like food!

choices: Yeah!  We can go there now.
1511112221212221111212111.content:
You're about to be eaten by the owl! Luckily, you hear the sound of a human approaching, a two-legged stride on the ground below. You hear a shout of dismay that sounds like the girl's voice, and she starts calling your name.

"Up here!" you shout, but as you do, the owl's head shoot out and you get snapped up in its beak. You're so small, though, that the owl can only fit your torso into its beak, so your legs and arms, and head too, simply dangle outside. You shout for help, and the girl sees you at last.

"Hey, let him go!" she shouts. Suddenly, the owl sets you down, and steps back. You fall over, your torso hurting from the pressure of the owl's sharp beak, and you hear the girl talk again.

"Good girl," she says. "Now, bring him back down here, careful."

The owl walks up to you again, eyeing you once again. You're afraid she will just eat you again, and you get scared when she reaches out a talon and grabs you in it. But, her grip is gentle, and she flies down to the table and places you carefully on it. You stand up, and see the young girl watching you with concern.

"Why did you leave the cage?" she asks as the owl returns to the rafters.

"Hey, I'm not a pet," you say. "I'm not going to stay in a rat cage!"

"You'd rather die?" she asks angrily.

You sigh. "Well, no... But I'd at least like to keep some dignity."

The girl looks with an understanding gaze. "Okay, I get it. I'm sure I'd feel the same way if I got shrunk. It's alright if you want to keep your dignity and all that. But for now, I'd recommend you follow my instructions, at least until you're normal again."

You nod. You can't exactly disagree anyway.

"So did you find that animal?" you ask her.

She replies...
1511112221212221111212111.title: The girl returns in time to help

15111122212122211112121111.content:
"I know where the animal is," she said. "My dad told me about it when I explained the crystal to him. He still doesn't know about you, by the way."

"Good," you say. "So, what animal is this? Someone magical?"

"Actually, no," the girl replies. "See, this animal can change your size. It's just an ordinary animal. But it's guarding a crystal that can apparently grow you to normal, and you'll have to get around it to get the crystal."

"Okay then... What animal is it?"

The girl replies, "It's ...."
15111122212122211112121111.title: An animal guards the crystal

choices: Other animals attack along e way!
151111222121222111121211111.content:
"A fox?" you ask. "Interesting... I met two of them already, maybe they're the same ones?"

The girl looked surprised, but happy too. "Really? Great! The story goes that there are two sister fixes who guard the stone, or crystal, or whatever. Maybe they're what you need to find!"

You nod. "Good. So, are you going to help me find them?"

The girl looks nervous. "Well, you see... My parents aren't letting me leave. They're mad I went to the first crystal, and they won't le t me go to any more places like that. So, I'll have to stay here."

You sigh. "Okay, that's not very good. How am I supposed to get there, then?"

As you ask this, the barn owl comes back down, landing on the girl's shoulder and watching you. At the same time, a sheepdog appears from somewhere deeper in the barn. The girl takes out the first crystal and holds it to the dog, who sniffs it and begins running off, barking."

The girl holds out her hand to you, palm vertical and facing you, and you see what she wants. You walk into her hand, and she gently grabs you and lifts you to her face.

"The dog will be able to find the other crystal," she explains as she brings her other hand below you and releases you so you fall into it. "And the owl can carry you. Hopefully, you won't have much trouble."

"Couldn't that dog carry me? Like, on it's back?" you ask her.

"That wouldn't be as safe as being held by my owl. I don't want you to be hurt," she says, a look of caring on her face.

"Alright then," you say. "Guess I'm off."

The girl says goodbye, and the owl takes off. She hovers behind you, so you're between her and the girl, and you look back and forth at them for a bit. Then, the owl reaches out and grabs you tightly in both her talons, and shoots off out of the barn with you, following the barking dog.
151111222121222111121211111.title: Plan to reach the crystal

choices: Your shirt rips and you get sent flying
The vixen decides to just try and eat you
1511112221212221111212111111.content:
You reach the cave safely, and the owl slows down. It was a frightening experience being held in the birds talons, and you wouldn't want it to happen again. The owl hovers near the ground and drops you off, and then lands on its talons behind you. The dog walks up too, barking into the cave. You look between them, still amazed at the size of animals at your height, and hit with the fact that it will all be back to normal soon. You steel yourself and walk into the cave, the dog and owl slowly following you.

The cave is small, and has holes in the ceiling to let in light. It lets you easily see a blue glow coming from deep in the cave, and it also let's you see two foxes lying down and resting on opposite sides of the cave.

Taking the opportunity, you start running towards the crystal. But you've barely nomads it halfway when you notice one of stirring. The fox stands up, and notices you, and as your eyes meet, you realize that the fox here actually is one of the vixens from before, the bigger one apparently. The fox barks, waking up the scond one, and the first one lunges at you.

You manage to dodge, and keep running. You look over your shoulder, and see the sheepdog blocking the vixen. They start barking at each other, but don't fight. You make it closer to the crystal, and it's glow seems to brighten. But suddenly, you hear thundering steps behind you, and turn to see the young vixen running at you, mouth open.

You try to dodge, but you're too late as the vixen snaps her jaws shut. Luckily, her sharp teeth only grip your shirt, but she is able to lift you off the ground and start shaking you. You shout and kick and punch wildly as you're flung around, the vixen trying to snap your neck or something else vital so you die. Instead, you only hear your shirt start to rip....
1511112221212221111212111111.title: Fight the foxes

15111122212122211112121111111.content: Your shirt rips, freeing you from the vixen's grip but also throwing you towards a wall. You prepare to hit it and die, but before you do, you hear a loud series of hooting noises, and get hit from the side. You don't fell yourself splatter against anything, though, and you open your eyes to see that the owl caught you in her talons. She glances down at you and hoots before swooping towards the crystal and dropping you straight onto it. You bounce past it, but feel yourself start to grow. You run back to the crystal, but see the younger vixen running at you to stop you. In a last burst of speed, you lunge for the crystal!
15111122212122211112121111111.title: One last chance!

choices: Well, there's only one way it can go now....
151111222121222111121211111112.content:
You get slammed into the ground right in front of the crystal. You feel yourself start to grow, but it's not enough. The vixen's paw comes down on you, and you can't move. Your head it free, though, and you see the vixen's own head move down and examine you. She growls, and lets out a loud roaring noise that surprises you. The vixen removes her paw, and you're about to make another lunge when her tongue gets in your way. You run right into it, and it curls you up and drags you into her maw again.

But by now, you're really angry. You've had enough of these giant animals manhandling you, and it's time you really fight back. You start to struggle with all your might, and the vixen actually seems to struggle with swallowing you. You realize she's planning to simply swallow you whole, not even bothering to chew. But you have an idea, and wait until a sliver of light enters through her partially parted teeth and reveals her uvula, and then you kick with all your might.

You hear the vixen start hacking, and you get dropped from her maw as she stumbles, coughing. You've been dropped right next to the crystal, and waste no time jumping at it!
151111222121222111121211111112.title: Is this the end?!

1511112221212221111212111111121.content:
The world goes white, and when you can see again, you're normal size. The two vixenish take a look at you and run away, and the sheepdog and owl just look in surprise. You're on your hands and knees in the cramped cave, and can see the crystal, no longer glowing, lying on the ground. You take it and pocket it, and get out quickly. You stand tall in the sunlight outside, happy to finally be back to normal. Even if you smell like lots of different animals, and are covered in drool, and have a torn shirt. At least you're back to normal.

The dog and owl leave the cave too, and seem happy that you're normal again as well. You start walking back in the direction you think the barn was, and reach it soon. The girl is in the barn, and seems happy to see you normal size again. You thank her for her help, and the animals return to her. You take a moment to marvel at how different she and the animals seem now that they aren't many times your size. Thinking no more of that, though, you wave goodbye and head back home.

Leaving the downs, and making it home safely, you think back on your experiences and wonder what may have happened had you made any different choices. You can't imagine, but you believe it would have involved lots more giant animals, and more likely than not, getting snatched, eaten, or otherwise killed by most of them. You think that this is probably one of the best ways it could have gone, but even so, one thought remains most prominent:

"I think I should keep an eye out for those crystals... And stay the heck away from them."
1511112221212221111212111111121.title: Happy ending

choices: Try and run to open her maw
15111122212122211112121111112.content:
You'd nearly fall as your shirt snaps, you'd manage to run a few more feet before tripping over your own foot, falling on your stomach, you'd begin to feel the breath of the vixen standing behind you, you'd try to get up, she'd use her paw and simply knock you back down.

She slowly opened her maw, her wet, slimy, soft tongue lapped out, licking your entire backside, you'd manage to roll onto your stomach, looking into her open maw, frozen in fear.

Suddenly, her tongue wrapped around you, pulling you into her maw. It snapped shut around you. Her tongue unwraps from you, you'd be facing her throat, you thought about forcing yourself down her gullet, or escaping.
15111122212122211112121111112.title: The vixen decides to just try and eat you

choices: Try and find a way out
151111222121222111121211111121.content: You crawl to her throat, her tongue relaxed under you. You'd force yourself down her throat, she was surprised, she'd swallow to help you go down, you'd eventually land in her stomach, she'd begin to walk around with you inside of her stomach, yet you weren't being digested.
151111222121222111121211111121.title: Crawl to her throat

choices: Continue following you inside the digestive system of the owl.
Continue as the girl as she tries to find the pellet you will turn into.
1511112221212221111212112.content: The owl decides that play time has turned into lunch time. He picks you up in his beak and bobs his head a few times until the only thing the rest of the world can see of you is your feet. The girl returns just in time to see you slide down into the gullet of the owl. She sighs deeply. You are gone, nothing but owl food.
