A rancid smell, that of the carnivore's diet, surrounds you as you begin to become a part of it. Your eyes slowly close, and you slip into unconciousness.

The eagle flies away to live and hunt another day.
1511121.title: Admiration leads to avarice.

1511122.content:
Although "AAAAAAHHHHH" is more a primal scream than a thought, you think, then say the word (or would that be an exclaimation?) of wisdom, taking off as quickly as you can.

The eagle, still slightly dazed from the fall, doesn't follow. It must not be too desperate for food if it's not after you. Once you're a good distance away, you notice the eagle crane its head to the east and take flight again. Obviously, it has found a more desirable foodstuff to try and capture.

You rest for a short while after that nerve-wracking encounter. Tall grass surrounds you now, blocking your view, and the view of any other large animal that could possibly want you for its own purpose. While resting, you hear squeaking. It could potentially be a group of small mammals. If a burrow was nearby, you could take shelter in one and plan your next advance.

You make your next decision swiftly.
1511122.title: Escaping the Eagle

choices: Hitch a Ride on a Passing Animal
Continue Climbing at a Slow Rate
1512.content:
As James walks around the down, stopped climbing by a restrictive fence, he wonders what life would be like amongst the animals on top; just then he feels dizzy and passes out.

When he comes to he finds himself in a strange world, with trees absent of leaves and with thick green trunks, then he realises that they aren't trees but blades of grass.

"Oh, my gods," He gasps, "I've shrunk!" He wades through the thick jungle of grass and comes to a huge wooden column, looking right up he sees that it's a fence post. "I can go up the down now!" He says to himself. "I won't be arrested because no one will see me!" He wlaks proudly around the fence post and under the wires, which seem to be 500ft above him; as he begins to climb he stops, realising that it'll be difficult to get all the way up the down by himself. Should he...
1512.title: Fences No Longer Apply

152.content: you walk into hilly terrain but one question , how big are you
152.title: a hilly terrain (goats, hedgehogs, moles, etc...)

1521.content: You go camping one day and park your car on a hill , at total randomness you start shrinking until you are 1 inch tall.You hear a noise in the distance , suddenly something emerges from a bush what is it ?
1521.title: 1 inch

15211.content: A goat walks out from behind the bush. You stare at the giant goat and it stares back at you.The goat walks over to you and lowers it's head and you are in the goats mouth , the goat swallows . You land in the goats stomach and start to digest while the goat burps and soon you die.
15211.title: goat

choices: Take you out to see what you are
It doesn’t like your taste and spit you out into a birds nest
15212.content: It’s a squirrel. You panic at the size of it, but slightly relax as it doesn’t see you. Backing up you bump into a hard smooth surface. Turning you see your surrounded by nuts on the ground. You attempt to go around them, but tripped and knocked two of the nuts together creating a clanking sound that attracted the squirrel. Standing back up, a shadow covers you, as the squirrel investigates the sound. Standing perfectly still you press yourself up against one of the nuts hoping the squirrel doesn’t notice you. With a happy chittering the squirrel grabs up a nut and pushes it into its mouth. After pressing a second nut into its mouth it reaches for the the one you’re hiding behind and as it grabs the nut it also pushes you up against it. The squirrel doesn’t seem to notice you pressed up against the night as it shoves both you and the nut into its mouth. It decides that with those three nuts it is time to return to its home in the tree. It scales the tree as your bounced around in its mouth and squeeze between the nuts. As the squirrel climbs thought the hole it starts to notice the particular taste this batch of nuts have. One by one the squirrel removes all three nuts from its mouth, but still can feel something else inside that seems to be giving off that taste. The squirrel decides to...
15212.title: squirrel

152121.content: The squirrel runs its tung along your back leaving a gooey trail of saliva on you before it closes its eyes clearly loving your taste. The squirrel closes its eyes and begins to make a purring noise as it savors your flavor. Inside its mouth, you are getting tossed and turned as the squirrel licks your body all over and you yell out for help just to be cut off as the squirrel used its tung to push you into it check making you visible bulge on the outside. "Hey stop it please im not food" you yell in a last attempt not to be eaten. the squirrel then stops and it decides to....
152121.title: Taste you somemore

choices: You are a new really tasty food
It understands and lets you go.
1521212.content:
The squirrel decided to see what is giving off that surprisingly delicious flavor. Swirling the object around on more time, the squirrel spits it out into its paw.

Taking in deep breaths of fresh air you wipe the saliva from your face. The squirrels fingers grip around you as you squirm in its paw. The grip startled you into looking up at the squirrels face. You are raised up to its nose, and feel like you are going to be sucked it, as it sniffed at you. Next you raised up further to its eye level for it to examine you.

“Uh.... Hello? I’m not sure if you can understand me, but I’m not food. I’m a human. Can you please let me go?” You attempt to communicate with it.

The squirrel looks at you as you talk and tilts it’s head to the side. The squirrel starts to chitter at you like it’s talking back. The squirrel then examined you by turning you over in its paws a few times. The squirrel decides that........
1521212.title: spits you out.

choices: It puts you in It’s mouth and swallows.
She lowers you down to her vagina and unbirths you.
15212122.content: The squirrel gives you one last tick before deciding to keep you as a pet. The squirrel hugs you to it’s warm, furry chest and cuddles you, this would be cute if it didn’t feel like you were a stuffed animal being hugged by a little kid. After about 10 minutes of this, the squirrel sees that it’s getting late and it should probably go to bed. It looks at your small form and assumes you would be cold due to your lack of fur. Fortunately, it knows just the place to keep you warm and safe. It pulls you from it’s chest and considers you for a moment.
15212122.title: It will keep you

choices: The bird is looking at you
The bird is about to sit on the eggs... and you
152123.content:
The squirrel swished you around a few more times, and next you know you are flying though the air. The squirrel must not have liked your taste and spit you out.

You land on a hard rough surface and roll until you bump into a smooth hard surface. Taking a few moments to wait out the pain and spinning,in your head and body, you push your self into a sitting position against the smooth surface. Slowly opening your eyes you take in the sticks and other debris around you. Pressing on the surface behind you, you stand on your wobbling legs, and walk to see where you are. Climbing a few sticks you see your still far from the ground in the tree. A hole where the squirrel must have made its home not far from you. Thinking to yourself how to get down you look around and notice a few smooth white stones in the debris too.

A flapping sound can be heard coming closer and you run for cover near the stones. The stones are warm to the touch, which you attribute to absorbing heat from the sun. The flapping sound gets closer and a shadow over takes your hiding spot. Then it hits you hard. These aren’t stones they are eggs and your in a nest. The shadow emerges and in the light you see it’s a bird, and From this angle you can’t tell the type. It’s head swings around as it looks at its nest. Quickly you hide between two of the eggs and hope the bird leaves so you can try to escape. The eggs around you shift around as the bird moves in the nest. You hiding spot grows darker as a shadow moves over you. Looking up you see.....
152123.title: It doesn’t like your taste and spit you out i...

choices: It thinks you are one of its babies
1521232.content:
You only see the underside of the bird. It’s legs tower on ether side of you. Before you can make any moves to escape the bird lowers it self down onto the eggs. The eggs shift and you end up trapped, pinned between two of them, and can’t move. The heat given off by the bird isn’t so bad and the feathers allowed air for you to breath. Between the heat, your strange day of scares and the pressure you fall into a slumbering sleep.

A cool Breeze blows over your body and you shiver. You try to reach for your sleeping bag cover but can’t find it. Opening your eyes, you are confused, till yesterday flashed in your mind. The bird is no longer sitting on its eggs, but it is staring at you. You struggle and manage to dislodge yourself and press up against the wall of the nest as the bird looks at you with a look of...
1521232.title: The bird is about to sit on the eggs... and you

choices: Let it out, it's too interesting to eat.
15212322.content:
It was the strangest thing, the bird was just sitting on her eggs when, going to reposition, they noticed a small being in the nest, sleeping. While a bug in their nest is like an easy snack, this bug was unlike any they've ever seen. It looked just like those giant beings they have encountered before, but tiny. The creature soon awoke, and backed itself into a corner from the sight of the bird. The bird drew closer to the small creature, leaning down to investigate it.

The bird closes the distance between you and it. You feel the breath of the avian on you, as its mouth leans almost centimeters away from you. You can see the whole interior, making you shiver in fear. You barely make a move, not wanting to provoke the birds predatorial instincts, but even your slightest move seems to trigger the birds quick reflexes, as it snaps you up into its maw. The tongue swishes through the bird's mouth, squishing to its meaty interior. You hear a noise from the back of the throat, as you move towards a destination.

Making a swift motion, the bird scoops up the small creature into the beak of the bird. Tasting it, it is nothing like what a bird has tasted before. No bug had ever had this flavor before, so it isn't one, but then what is it? The bird decides to...
15212322.title: Caught the eye of a bird.

153.content: Pick a size for our protagonist to be.
153.title: Size does matter, you know.

choices: Set out to look for help.
1531.content:
Spectacular! Breathtaking! Supercalifragilisticexpe- ah, never mind. No matter what adjectives you tried to come up with, the fjord you saw laying before you defied any of these words. It was a vacation, but more of an adventure for yourself. Being the outdoorsman type, you find more wisdom in your travels than from any old book. Set against a harsh grey backdrop, the mighty fjord was intimidating, almost enough to trigger second thoughts, but this is what you paid big money for.

You set out to make camp on this harsh terrain, eventually landing a spot off the shore just a few hundred feet or so from the frigid water. You pitch your tent and make camp, sighing and taking in the brisk air of the land. A passerby raises an eyebrow at your seemingly light dress, but you know that in your mind, the weather didn't bite as hard as people thought it did. Wimps.

A glimmer reflects off of your eye. Curious, you make you way over to it, revealing an extremely shiny crystal. You're no miner, but that thing looks like it could be worth quite a lot of money! Even so, it looked to be partially sticking out, anyhow. As soon as you touch it to move it, you feel like you've just been stung in the hand. Looks like you may need a sharp tool after all.

As you walk back, you notice things are looking a little bigger...and growing! By the time you make it to your tent, it's too late. You've now been shrunk!

You merely find it incredibly strange, and think about what you'll do next.
1531.title: Welcome to the Fjord...

choices: ...walk on out and try to attract the attention of whoever that is?
...hide in your tent until the steps pass by.
15311.content:
You decide that the simplest and safest road would be to not traverse one, and simply wait at the tent. After all, somebody had to notice a tent, and look for its inhabitant, right?

You ponder over what sort of power that crystal really had. Was it a crystal just for bringing people down to size, or had it some other purpose?Maybe touching it ungloved was a bad idea...

You hear footsteps come to your left side. A savior? Another human? Or could that be something else...? Do you...
15311.title: Stay calm, and stay there.

153111.content:
You rush out, ready and eager to greet whoever it is that might be out there, and kindly ask for their assistance. "Hello there!" Unfortunately, you may not get much help from a hunting, lone wolf.

Curious, the wolf sniffs you over for a second, and determines that you will indeed make a good prey item. You sprint off in the other direction and hear the strangest noise as the wolf pursues you...can wolves laugh? It quickly catches you with a paw, removing the paw, only to bring you into its maw. Slimy, wet, dripping, and that breath...how rancid! You're not here for too long as the wolf quickly shifts you from the front of the mouth to the back, gulping you into its throat. Sliding down quickly, you feel the embrace of the guller's muscles, all trying to bring you down, and succeeding at that. You soon land in the wolf's belly, which unfourtinately for you, is already starting the marvelous process of digestion. Landing in a vat of painful acids, you scramble to make your way to higher ground, and manage to board a small berry bushel the wolf had eaten. As the acids pile up, the fruit floats for a short while before sinking, taking you into that soupy mixture of nutrients, acid, and certain death. Feeling some intense pain, you pass out long before your body is truly dissolved.

The wolf, meanwhile, will live another day. After digesting you, he continues on, hunting a small mammal or 2.
153111.title: Oh, uh, hi there. ^_^;;

choices: Yes, so it's OFF to build a weapon!
Nope, I could take them on bare-handed!
153112.content:
You decide to get in your tent and hide behind one of the opening flaps, whatever's out there could be dangerous. You are, after all, out in the wild, with wild animals, with wild appetites.

You made a very wise decision. You hear the soft padding of 4 little pads on the ground, and you know it to be a wolf. Glad you didn't ask for help now, aren't you? The wolf passes by without incident, and heads out on the trail for some small mammals.

Knowing it's safe, you head on out again. The realization that at any time you are in danger certainly isn't comfortable even for one as adventerous as yourself. The only way to be safe, you decide, is just to not get caught by anything. You aren't exactly at a stature to fight anything other than ants, and there weren't any of those here, thankfully.

You do need a way to fight any other predators that would come your way...right?
153112.title: Better Safe than Eaten

choices: Take a slim chance, and swim towards land.
1531121.content:
You decide that having a weapon is the best defense against, well, anything that could happen. You stake out, cautiously looking about for any potential threats. Any animal could see you and think 'Chow!!'.

You head towards a small enbankment on the edge of the water. Seeing some desirable materials, you lean to a percarious perch leaning dangerously close to the water, and end up falling in. Quite the long fall for someone your size, but you make it in without incident, swimming up to the surface. Once you emerge and breathe in some air, you realize that the perch you were leaning from is far too high to be reached again. You drift aimlessly down the division in the fjord, and figure there's about a slim to none chance of actually returning to dry land.

Well, you're here now in this frigid water. Better make the most of it. What are you going to do now?
1531121.title: 'Water' You Waiting for? Build a weapon!

15311211.content:
You think about the situation, and that you're in here already. Might as well go for a dive, right?

You kick up your legs and begin your descent, eyes adjusting to the water, but still blurring your sight. You look about, and cannot see much at all. It isn't very bright, and what little you can see appears to be drably colored...you think so, anyway.

Up from behind you, a sucking sound is heard, and you're immediately placed into a fish's maw. It quickly gulps you down, leaving little time to observe the mouth or even question what just gulped you down into its stomach. This happens almost as immediately as the sucking in, and you're left dazed and confused. Quick jolting movements bump you all around in the belly, and there is one final movement which literally smashes you against the wall of the stomach for a short time before you simply lie down and accept your fate. The fish's acids are quite painful, and cause you to simply black out before it can reach your vital organs.

As for what was going on outside, it was a rainbow smelt that saw you and rushed after your tiny frame, gulping you down on the spot. Afterward, a brook trout came along and snapped up the tiny smelt that you were in, resulting in the wild actions of your moving around in the stomach. In a way, you were eaten twice. You'll also be digested twice.
15311211.title: You thought you 'smelt' something fishy...

15311212.content:
Well, you've won many competitions and bets involving your swimming, and you'll be darned if you're going to die like this!

Despite the growing odds against you, you decide to powerfully swim towards land. Swimming with the stroke you know best, you pump your arms and legs with one thought: that of survival. Your swimming makes an amusingly small racket on the surface.

In the water, a moderately sized brook trout searches out its next meal. Already having made quick work of a few rainbow smelt just to have the rest swim away, it desired something different for its tastes. Swimming towards the surface, it sees the splashings of what appears to be a tiny little insect at the surface of the water. It quickens its pace to get it before any other fish can...

Still swimming powerfully, you notice a shadow coming up from under you, but its already too late. The sharp-toothed maw of a trout closes around you, and your whole world moves into darkness. It quickly takes you down to its bony throat, which is quite abrasive and painful. You receive a minor cut in your arm before sliding the rest of the way down. As you arrive, drops of blood spill from your arm as you try to stop thinking about the pain and more about where you were. That didn't take long to piece together, and panic sets in. You furiously pound at the walls, but this only causes the gastric juices to come out before they're ready, burning into your skin and throwing you to the ground with pain. This only increases the volume of the juices, and tears pour out of your eyes as you slowly lose conciousness. Eventually, there's nothing to think about any more...
15311212.title: No Doubt about Trout

1531122.content:
Even if there were ants here, you think, I could take them on bare-handed. Strength training, lifting excercises, you're bad to the bone. As you pull off a bit of amusing macho posturing, you barely have time to take notice of the puffin that just flew to your camp and stopped by for a quick snack. But wait, there's no fish here...

The seemingly giant bird makes its way over to you, letting you get just a few inches away from it before snapping you up in its oddly shaped beak. It takes no delay in gulping you down, almost gulping as quickly as a seagull would with a fish. With the first gulp, your middle is left in its beak, and the second gulp sends you on your way. The peristalic action takes over, and works you into the crop. Being a musclehead, you have no idea that this isn't the bird's stomach, but rather where the chewing of prey takes place. This works as both a crushing blow to your ego and to your body. Ouch? Very ouch. The air is squeezed out of your body, and after a minute of not breathing, you succumb and suffocate all at once to the birds digestive system.

Almost makes you wish you'd have just taken the business trip to San José. Almost.
1531122.title: Huff'n, Puffin, and blowing away your ego

15312.content:
It will not do you much good to sit here and wait for help. Chances are it will be days before help comes. There are a lot of things that could happen to you in that frame at your size.

As you set out you discover you are having a hard time navigating. It is much more difficult locating landmarks from this unfamiliar perspective. You decide to head toward the shoreline and try to navigate your way home from there. It is not really any more or less dangerous to do so since this area was teeming with life that could take yours.

When you make it to the shoreline you begin what is bound to be a long journey home. Shortly after reaching the shore...
15312.title: First Step

153121.content:
There is a sleek shape out in the water. With a sudden sense of alarm you know the shape is headed in your direction. You begin to run. Whatever is in the water easily out paces you. It reaches the shoreline and a furry head and webbed paw emerge from the water. What stands before you is an otter that seems as large as any dinosaur to you.

You are still running. The otter is easily keeping pace with you. It is genuinely curious about just what you are. It is sniffing you and gently batting you around with its paw as you try to flee. This normally cute creature is now a terrifying sight as you get the occasional glimpse of fangs nearly the same size as yourself.

After a while the otter comes to a decision. It...
153121.title: Cute Giant

1531211.content:
The otter suddenly takes you into its maw. Its breath is putrid, like the smell of rotten fish. The otter's tongue begins to lick you against the roof of its mouth, covering you in its saliva and that horrible smell. You hold out hope that the otter will let you go.

The otter has a different idea. It thinks that you may not taste as good as its normal diet, but you are already in its mouth. An easy meal is just fine and you don't taste bad. With that thought the otter swallows you. You find yourself descending the gullet of the otter and being deposited in a belly that smells even worse than the mouth.

The otters digestive juices begin to go to work on you. You think the otter is swimming again do to the rhythmic motions of the belly. You are slowly falling asleep due to the lack of oxygen, it is just the pain keeping you awake. Sleep finally begins to take over when you feel a pounding against the stomach. It must be breaking something against it you think as sleep takes over.

The otter finds a couple other things to eat before retiring for the day. It will survive to eat another day. You, however, will remain as just an odd interruption in its normal routine.
1531211.title: Not So Cute Fate

1531212.content:
Your scent is unfamiliar to the otter. Since you do not smell like food the otter soon decides to go look for something that does smell like food. To your relief the otter turns to leave and you continue on your journey as well.

You eventually find what looks like a familiar location that you could use to navigate toward help. You continue into the forest. You manage to keep walking for a couple of hours without running into any serious danger and you hope your luck will hold out.

Immediately after that thought you here a noise behind you. Whatever is behind you sounds enormous. It does not sound like it is more than 20 feet away to you. You hope it is something that will not decide to make a meal of you as you turn around. What you see is...
1531212.title: Limited Luck

15312121.content:
There is a large gray wolf towering above you. It has paused in its step. The wolf must have been trying to sneak up on you and misstepped. You were being hunted and you started to run as instinct took over. The wolf discovered that it did not have to sneak around as it discovered how slow you were compared to it. It pinned you down with a paw less than two seconds after you started to run.

Your scent may have been unfamiliar to the wolf, but you still looked like a small mammal to it. The wolf licked you and you could tell it found your taste to its liking. As the wolf lifted its paw off of you, you tried to run again. The wolf caught you by your legs and tossed you in the air.

You had a good view of the wolf's waiting gullet as you descended through the air. The landing was actually very soft as you came down on the wolfs tongue. It quickly swallowed you. You were delicious to the wolf and it went to try and find more of the tasty new small mammals. You on the other hand were stuck in the wolf's belly.

You turned on a light you had with you to get a look at the interior of your temporary residence. The wolf has not eaten today as you see nothing else in the belly of the beast. Digestive juices are just beginning to flood in to do their job on you. You are knocked out do to the lack of air in almost the same amount of time it takes the wolf's powerful digestive system to finish with you. Thus you are reduced to just another small part of the food chain.
15312121.title: Luck Runs Out

15312122.content:
There is a titanic moose a short distance from you. It is grazing peacefully, not even paying attention to you. The moose would probably be just as much a danger to you at your regular size due to how aggressive they can be. Not being noticed by a moose that weighs thousands of tons compared to you can present its own dangers though.

The moose is grazing in your direction and you decide to get out of the way. This may have been a mistake as the moose seems to have noticed something. You hope that it was not your attention that caused the reaction. It is soon apparent...
15312122.title: Noticed?

153121221.content:
The moose is definitely looking at you. It seems to notice that you have a human scent. This seems to set something off in the moose. It is now chasing you. When it catches up it tries to trample you.

You dive out of the way of a few falling hooves. It seems an exercise in futility as you can tell you are tiring faster than the moose. Exhaustion soon takes you and you trip and fall on a rock. You look up and see a hoof descending directly on you. At this distance it will be impossible to dodge.

The split hoof the moose descends on you with lightning speed. Your death is instantaneous as the hoof lands on you and grinds your body into paste. The moose sniffs your remains and snorts. Pleased that it has removed the unwanted intrusion from its domain, the moose continues its daily forging and soon forgets all about you.
153121221.title: Enraged Moose

153121222.content:
The moose walks in the opposite direction you are headed. You sigh in relief and continue on. You come across other animals occasionally and are forced to either run or hide in terror.

It seems like you have traveled miles, but at your size you will be lucky if you had gone two miles. Even though you are tired you press on. You probably should have rested. If you had you may have been able to notice the drop off ahead of you.

You slip down the slick hill. Bits of debris are hitting you on the way down as you try to grab for a hold and stop yourself. Your hand finally catches on to something. When you look to see what it is your eyes widen in surprise. It looks like the crystal that originally shrunk you. Then you start...
153121222.title: Another Crystal

1531212221.content:
The environment around you begins growing again. You let go of the crystal but you continue shrinking. When you are finished shrinking you are only the size of a large ant. It would be a good idea to avoid further contact with these crystals as they seem to shrink you whenever you touch them. There is no telling how many more of the things are in the area.

Your journey has become much longer, but you must continue on. It is not long before you feel a series of tremors. Those tremors are spaced at steady intervals and obviously belong to an animal many times your size. You hide until you feel the tremors stop.

When you think it is safe you emerge from your hiding spot and walk right into a large furry wall with a claw sticking out of it. You look over to your side and see the head of the wolf that toe belongs to sniffing the ground. It had barely noticed you touch its paw, but it did notice. The wolves eyes lock on to you and you freeze for just a moment before fleeing.

The wolf pins you down with a single on of its toes. It begins to sniff you with its large wet nose. The wolf...
1531212221.title: Human Ant

15312122211.content:
The wolf seems to like your smell since it begins drooling on you. You just hope that it will consider you to small to be worth the effort. But the wolf is hungry and you smell tasty. Every little bit counts to the wolf.

The wolf lets you up and wraps you in its powerful tongue. You try to fight your way out of the tongue, but its grip on you is to strong. It takes you into its maw. It licks against the roof of its mouth, seeing if you taste as good as you smell. The wolf attempts to chew on you, but you are able to avoid its teeth. This gives you some hope. However, the wolf grows tired of you and decides to swallow you.

You are on the wolf's tongue when it lurches violently and sends you hurtling into the wolf's gullet. The powerful muscles of the wolf quickly pulled you into the wolf's belly. The smell was unbearable. Fortunately you did not have to deal with it long. You directly in a pool of digestive acids and are quickly turned into nutrients for the wolf.

The wolf praised its luck. This had to be the third one of those tasty new bugs it had found today. They seemed to have appeared along with those new shinny rocks. It decided to make them a permanent part of its diet.
15312122211.title: Smells Delicious

choices: the wolf's rear paw above you.
the wolf walk away from you.
15312122212.content:
The wolf licks you a little bit. After it curiosity has been satisfied it starts to sniff at other things. The wolf must have decided that the tiny bug was not worth its time since it is not an insectivore. It has not let you up either. The massive toe still has you pinned firmly to the ground.

You try to get out from under the toe while the wolf is not paying attention. No matter what you do you cannot move until the toe lifts up slightly. You get out from under the toe as quickly as you can. Good thing to as you see the toe dig deep into the ground a second later, you would have been crushed.

Then you find out why the toe flexed like that. It was preparing to take a step. You duck as the toe heads toward you and manage to avoid being decapitated by it. The toe still clips you and sends you reeling. You are left laying face down in the ground. When you roll over you see...
15312122212.title: Escape

153121222121.content:
You are a bit woozy from the impact. When your vision clears you hope you are dreaming. The wolf may not have crushed you with a front paw, but you can see a rear paw coming right down on you. You attempt to get up and run and pain shoots up your right causing you to fall over again.

It would not have helped you anyways. Even if you had been able to run, the paw is descending on you faster than you could have avoided it. All you can do is look up and analyze the paw. Your life flashed before your eyes as the four toes with claws larger than you came closer and closer. It eventually came down on you with untold tons of crushing force.

As if making sure you were dead the wolf pivoted on the paw you were under. If by some miracle you had managed to survive the twisting motion would have ground you into paste. Thus your life came to an end, just one more bug that had been crushed by nature's larger creatures.
153121222121.title: Still In Danger

153121222122.content:
As the wolf walks away, you wonder what you should do next. It's surprising you're still alive, and you realize that almost any animal could easily kill you at this size. You remember finding those crystals, and how they shrunk you, and you decide you should keep an eye out for them. Maybe there are also crystals like them that could grow you to normal size again, but it'll be tough to locate them at your size.

You look all around at the cold and rocky landscape. You can see a bunch of trees one way, and a small river elsewhere. Where should you go next?
153121222122.title: Where to go next in this fjord?

1531212221222.content: With no better ideas, you randomly pick the river. You're aware that otters live in the fjord, but you just hope none show up and eat you. You reach the river after a long, tiring walk, and you can see some ripples in the water, probably caused by otters or fish. You stay back to see what happens, and you see...
1531212221222.title: To the river

15312122212222.content:
As you watch the rippling, you see a furry mass slowly surface. As water drips from it, you realize it's an otter with brown fur and long whiskers. It floats on its back, looking at the banks of the river for predators, when it suddenly seems to notice you. It stops, and quickly swims to the shore near you. You step back a bit before realizing it would be hopeless to try and run, so you just walk towards the otter. It seems to be surprised at your bravery, and keeps moving towards you. It reaches the land and climbs onto the shore, walking on its short legs as water drips from its dark fur. Hit with a bit of curiosity, and shamelessness, you crouch down and glance between its hind legs through the fur. You feel a bit wrong for doing that, but you're able to tell that this otter is female.

The otter walks up to you, standing over you and blocking the sun. You just stare up at her black eyes, wondering what she plans to do with you. The otter bends down and sniffs at you, then quickly licks you with her tongue. Your clothes are lifted up and then dropped down again when she licks you, causing them to get covered in drool. The otter makes a hacking sound, like she doesn't like your taste, probably because your clothes taste weird. But the otter stays there, looking down at you, and...
15312122212222.title: Giant otter attack!

choices: A big, mean looking bear eyeing you
A shiny crystal, colored different than the earlier ones!
153121222122222.content:
Suddenly, the otter's head lowers, her mouth open. You're scared she'll eat you, but have no time to get away before her maw is around you completely. She snaps you up, holding you in her maw and swishing you around with her tongue. You struggle, punching and kicking to try and hurt her maw, but you're only about half an inch tall now, so you can't hurt her much. After a short while of this, she stops, and you feel her running while still holding you in her mouth. You can hear a loud splash from outside, and feel yourself get tossed around. Then, suddenly, light returns, and you tumble out of the otter's maw. You stand up slowly, coughing from the experience and trying to get the saliva off you, and then realize just where you are.

You're standing on the otter's chest, with her front paws just an inch away from you on either side. Looking up, you see her face looking down at you curiously. You realize she's floating on her back in the river, and is taking this time to examine you. You sit down, glancing at the paws next to you, and worry that she might be able to crush you between them. You're also still a bit scared from being grabbed in her mouth, and you're surprised she didn't just eat you then. You suppose you didn't taste too good, and you weren't big enough for her to bother.

You keep sitting on the otter's chest as she floats down the river, and she glances at you every once in a while to see if you're trying to get away. Most of the time, she's just looking downriver to see where she's going. You're surprised how peaceful it is right now, even though you're less than an inch tall and under this otter's power for now.

As you float along, you notice someone from the shore....
153121222122222.title: Riding the otter downstream

1531212221222222.content:
You notice a shiny blue crystal, differently colored than the red one before. You shout out and try to jump from the otter's chest to the shore, but just as your feet leave her body, her paws clamp shut around you, leaving just your head and arms free. You squirm and struggle to escape, but the otter doesn't react. She ignores you, continuing to drift downstream.

After a while, the otter releases you, and you crumple to her chest. She looks at you with an expression that seems like genuine concern, which surprises you. You look up at her black eyes set in her fuzzy face, and suddenly get sad. You just passed up the last chance to grow to normal size you had, and it's all that stupid otter's fault!

Suddenly, you lunge at the otter, punching her snout. She lets out a pained cry, swinging her paws at you. You cling to her face, though, your rage letting you hang on. But you can't hang on forever, and the otter rolls over and dips her head underwater. In the cold water, you're forced to let go and come up for air, and that's when the otter quickly comes up from under you and snaps you up in her maw again.

You struggle and try to escape, but once again, it's pointless. You feel the otter moving quickly through the water, and feel like she's about to eat you in return for hitting her. But, surprisingly, when the light returns and you fall out of her opened maw, you see she has brought you to the shore, close to where you spotted the crystal. You look up at the soaking otter standing over you, dripping river water onto your tiny body to mix with the saliva coating you, and stand up. The otter makes a strange squeaking noise, and then turns away and runs back into the river.

You stand still, soaked in water and drool. Did that otter just help you? It's like she knew what you wanted, and helped you get back to the crystal....

Smiling slightly, you start making your way to where the crystal should have been....
1531212221222222.title: Giant otter girl: friend or foe?

15312122212222222.content:
You manage to make it to the blue crystal without incident. Standing near it, you can actually feel yourself growing again. You're happy it's finally about to end.

But it can never be so easy. You hear thundering steps, and turn to see a huge bear walking towards you! You run out of its way, but it notices you! It roars and tries to step on you, but you bately avoid its paws. You wonder why it's so angry to see such a small animal, but you figure it thinks you're a dangerous bug of some kind because it's never seen you before. You can feel yourself slowly growing as you stand next to the crystal, but the bear hasnt noticed. In fact, it seems focused on killing you, not figuring out what you are.

Which explains why it quickly chomps you in its mouth and starts to swallow you whole.
15312122212222222.title: You get there easily

153121222122222222.content:
You struggle more than ever before, ad feel your feet kick something that gives. Suddenly, the bear starts retching, and you get spat out. You realize you just kicked its uvula, making it spit you out. Lying mostly beneath it, you are once again in a position to notice the bear is female, and have just enough time to notice that disturbing trend in the animals you've seen before the bear bites at you again. Luckily, you've been growing enough to be able to cover more ground while dodging, and manage to stay close to the crystal so it keeps you growing. The bear seems to realize something is going on, and relents for a bit. In that moment, you spot exactly where the glow is coming from and lunge. Touching the crystal, you feel a surge of energy, and the world around you goes white.

When you can see again, you realize you are normal size again. The bear is watching you in fear, and runs away. You stand tall, happy you're normal size again, an realize you're holding the crystal. It's not glowing anymore, and you figure that the size changing powers of it and it's counterpart have most likely faded after you used them.

You pocket the growth crystal and make your way back to where this whole mess started so you can claim the shrink crystal. Finding the two that shrunk you on this trip, you take them too, noticing how they don't glow or shrink you at all.

Having found all the crystals, and grown to normal size, and hopefully never needing to go through this awful ordeal again, you begin to head back home. You make it safe and sound, passing by a few animals, including a familiar looking otter who seems to wave at you, and as you step into your house, you say one thing with a small smirk.

"Worst vacation ever."
153121222122222222.title: You manage to get out!

1532.content: Pick a size for our protagonist to be.
1532.title: Size still matters.

choices: Lie down and play dead, maybe it'll ignore you.
15321.content:
The fjords always seemed like the perfect getaway for hard-working types like yourself. Now you were here, and it couldn't have been more picture-esque if it tried. It was better than the guidebook had made it out to be!

You quickly find a spot to make camp, and pitch your tent. Let's just say that it looks a lot easier in the instructions. You fumble with the thing for a full 20 minutes before you finally set up camp...it would be perfect if one side of the tent wasn't lop-sided. You shrug it off, it's all part of the learning process, you think.

You take a brisk hike to get used to your surroundings. Not being used to such brisk air gives you a surprsing amount of energy. Hiking for nearly 5 miles, you stop to take a rest near a small cave and a cliff leading down into the water. Normally you're not adventurous, but you decide to explore the cave anyhow, taking a flashlight along for the trip. Other than a swarm of bats that flies out at you, it doesn't seem like anything out of the ordinary.

Venturing further in, you come upon a small wooden crate. It looked old, and very breakable. Merely kicking it raises the lid, which breaks off of its hinge. Inside, you find a small, glimmering pearl. Picking it up, it feels cool to the touch, if not a bit too cold for your tastes. You place it in your pocket, and begin walking towards the cave's entrance. You notice that the entrance looks bigger than usual. It dawns on you as the celing raises even higher. Did the cave just get bigger?

Nope, you've just gotten smaller. Much smaller. Three inches tall now, you head towards the entrance a bit more slowly now. When you get outside, you notice that a bear is closing in on the cave you just got out of. Heck of a way to start your relaxing vacation, now isn't it?

What are you going to do?
15321.title: What a start to your vacation, huh?

153211.content:
Remembering more than a few nature specials you had watched before coming here, you lie down on the ground and act as if you were dead. It's tough, but you manage to stay still as the bear makes its approach.

The bear lumbers over to you on all fours, and then it notices the tiny creature below its nose. Sniffing cautiously, it determines the tiny animal to be dead, and slurps it up with its broad tongue. Nice, easy prey.

Much to your chargain, the bear decided to take you in for whatever reason. This causes you to struggle around out of sheer panic. The bear suckles on your body for a while, lathering you in sticky, slimy bear drool. The powerful tongue prods your entire body. Shortly afterward, the bear begins to move you towards the back of the throat. You cling to the tongue, but there's no use. The strong throat ripples around you and begings working you down, and all around you there's a powerful audible gulp as you are pushed towards the stomach. Powerful muscles contract and push your body. Finally, you reach the belly of the beast. It is quite large, but not the least bit accomodating. Acids immediately begin work on your body, and you writhe in pain until they reach a point on your body which makes everything stop for good.

Late summer is a great time for bears to forage and build up their strength for the still fairly far away winter hibernation. Looks like you got caught up in it. At the very least, you'll give the bear a few minutes extra sleeping time come winter.
153211.title: Can't Grin and Bear it

choices: Dive on in, swim down, and have a look.
Continue to float aimlessly on the surface.
153212.content:
Narrowly, you miss avoiding the bear's attention as you run towards the water. You decide out of sheer fear that there is no chance to survive unless you jump. Thinking with pure instinct, you power your legs towards the cliff and simply let yourself drop off of it.

Luckily, there was nothing to break your fall except for the water below. It hurts quite a bit, but you manage to survive the fall into the water. Bobbing at the surface now, you observe a lack of a proper surface to cling onto to get yourself up back up to land. You really have no choice but to be at the mercy of the current and let it take you wherever it pleases. You could enjoy yourself still, despite your smaller stature. You see an opportunity to dive in and observe the local wildlife without scaring it all off. Of course, you could also just aimlessly drift, staying on the somewhat safe surface. Your call.
153212.title: Jump on in, the water's great.

choices: Go to the surface, take a breather, explore further.
1532121.content:
A vacation, to you, can't be ruined by a change in size. You conside that any time's a good time for 2 things: IHOP, and diving. As much as you'd love a stack of pancakes, you're not near one, so diving will have to suffice.

You kick up your feet, and begin to descend into the water. Being only a bit murky, you can see everything pretty well. There's a lot of beautiful aquatic plants and animals around. Looking all about, you notice a variety of fish and invertebrates, and wish your guidebook was waterproof so that you could know which types they were. The breath you took to get down here is nearly depleted.
1532121.title: Diving down to check out the fish.

15321211.content:
If you weren't on tabs for air, you would laugh as you approach an odd-looking creature. It almost reminds you of a mythical sea creature. It lazily waves what appear to be tentacles around, probably just looking for a bite to eat.

Curious, you swim over to one of the tentacles, and make what might be the last mistake of your entire life. Touching the hydra's tentacle is a huge mistake for anything that might be small enough to be made a meal. It sends a piercing shock through your body, paralyzing you all over. A once lazy tentacle now wraps around you and slowly brings you down towards an ever-gaping maw. You'd struggle if it wasn't for the paralyzing pain in your body. Heck, you're surprised your heart hasn't stopped from it.

The tentacle deposits its catch into the maw, and it takes what seems like forever to reach a stopping point. You're slooooowwwwwwly moved along by the beating of tiny little hairs to its digestive cavity. At this point, you're already drowned, and won't be able to feel the slow digestion of your body. Curiousity kills more than cats, it would seem.
15321211.title: Lunch for a... Cnidrian?!

choices: What's that, out of the corner of your eye...?
Meet with the surface yet again for some air.
15321212.content:
Feeling your lungs burn slightly for air, you kick to the surface quickly, apparently avoiding something that had been heading your way. You break the surface, and take huge gulps of air. The sun shines brilliantly down on you. You take a moment to catch your breath at the surface. Then, you swim a bit father along, going with the current to help with your speed. Once you're at a point just a tad bit further along, you kick up your legs and once again dive down.

Not much has changed surroundings-wise, but you do observe a few different fish, ones that weren't around at the other spot. Some rainbow-colored fish were being pursued by a hungry and bigger fish you assume to be a trout. Luckily, it heads out of your way. As you watch them speed off into the distance, you feel your lungs cry out for air once again.
15321212.title: Moving along to fish of a different color.

153212121.content:
As your lungs cry out for air, something piques your interest. Out of the corner of your eye, you can't help but notice something, and turn to take a look. It would be, unfortunately, the last look you'd ever take of something in the outside world.

A trout, in cohorts with the other trout, notices an easier meal sitting right in front of it. Rather than expend the energy to continue the chase, it goes for the tiny human in the water instead.

You slip into its toothy maw, being careful not to be impaled by any of them. You slide, to your relief, to the center of its mouth. It quickly swallows you and speeds forward to catch up with its partner. You feel as if you're going to be torn apart by the sharp, shredding throat. Although badly wounded, you make it into the stomach alive. Fishy remnants surround you, as do some fish eggs and even a slimy piece of bread. You sigh dejectedly and accept your fate as fish food. The digestion starts slowly and painfully. You scream in agony as the acids end your life and your vacation similtaneously.
153212121.title: Taken by the Other Trout

153212122.content:
You power through the water, determined to get your breath again. Sweet, powerful air flows through your body as you break the surface. This time, you take a bit longer to gather your air. Some seagulls call out from above, making you the slightest bit nervous. Was this a fjord or a beach?

Giving you no time to answer that most obvious question, a powerful force sweeps you downward and into a very dark place. You feel a few other things hit you as well, but just barely. Sweeping them off of your face, you notice something very, very wrong. A mouth opens up again, and your room is revealed, appearing to be the maw of a whale shark. Stuck to one of its gill rakers, you struggle without much success. Soon, you are gulped down along with the rest of its food, and you arrive in a moderately large room, reeking of a certain fishy odor. Sighing dejectedly at first, then proceeding to futily beat on the huge shark's stomach, your stamina is depleted, and you collapse, falling asleep for the last time. You're merely left to become a tiny part of a large animal. It would be sort of poetic if it didn't end your vacation and your life, now wouldn't it?
153212122.title: Air's a deadly mistake this time.

choices: The water gently rolling on to shore. (still in the fjord area)
1532122.content:
You decide to just float on the surface, close your eyes, and enjoy the sun. Diving would just bring unwanted, unhealthy attention.
After a while you hear...
1532122.title: Surface = Safety... Right?

15322.content: There's just one last specific choice on here for you.
15322.title: Yes, size still matters.

choices: Set out and look for help.
153221.content:
It was the perfect plan. Escape life for a while, get out and see the great outdoors, and just get away for a while. There was no better place on earth to that than the grand fjords, you thought as you stepped out into the open air. The breeze was brisk, and the skies...well...they weren't exactly up to par with what you had in mind, but this was to be expected. At least, that's what your trusty guidebook told you.

You set camp and arrange everything for your stay, then decide to hike up a lone path. It didn't look very traversed, and you've always had a love for the road less traveled. The path looked as if nobody had taken it for years, and many downed boulders and tree branches block the path. You reach what appears to be the end, and are just about to head back when something catches your eye. A mere glimmer, you dig around the ground until you come up with a beautiful pearl. Where a pearl like this could have come from puzzles you, but it feels cold to the touch. You find that you can't hold it for very long, and place it in a vest pocket.

As you make your way back to camp, things start getting more difficult. Tree branches are bigger than you remember them, boulders are much harder to climb up and over, and by the time you get back to camp, you definitely know something is wrong when you can go into your tent without even opening it up. You step outside your tent and look around, merely 6 inches tall, and determine your next course of action.
153221.title: A road less traveled, and a reduction in size.

choices: Step outside the tent and attract their attention.
1532211.content: Rather than venture out and undoubtably get no farther than a couple thousand feet, you decide to stay at your camp, hoping and waiting for someone to happen by you, maybe even give you a hand. Minutes pass, hours pass...you manage to eat some of your rations, which are now quite a bit bigger and fill you up much faster than they normally would. Still more time passes by, and nothing. You sleep inside your safe tent, and now nearly a day has passed with no assistance. Still making use of a single ration, you finally hear something outside of your tent. It sounds like it could be somebody, and after waiting all of this time, who knows if another will come by the time you're supposed to return home from the trip. You decide to...
1532211.title: Waiting and waiting...

15322111.content:
Hoping for a would-be giant human to notice your smaller stature, you run outside of the tent, and begin waving your hands, shouting "Hey! Over here!" By the time you open your eyes, it's obvious that you've made a fairly huge mistake.

The harbor seal turns its head and begins flopping (for lack of a better word) over in your direction fairly quickly. Its form is gigantic to you, and fairly dangerous. Paralyzed by fear (and maybe fascination), you're unable to move, even as the seal begins peering down at your tiny form. Sniffing you over, it quickly takes you into its maw, overwhelmingly reeking with the aftertaste of fish, leaving only your kicking legs dangling out of its mouth. This is quickly fixed as you are gulped into the throat. The muscular throat contracts, pulling you down with quite some speed. You are then deposited into the belly, which is full of rotting fish, yet to be digested. Some still move about as you land on in. A general sliminess surrounds you, and the smell of the room is almost undescribable, much like that of some sort of fish market gone wrong. The warm air begins to pound on you worse than any sun would, and you simply fall into unconciousness before the digestion begins.

Lumbering back to the shoreline to take a quick swim, the seal makes good use of your body along with all of the fish it ate. Of course, this means that the ration you had out will rot, other animals will eat the rest of thefood you had, and life will go on, sans you.
15322111.title: Looks like you just sealed your fate.

choices: "I need to bring you to my village."
15322112.content:
After a while of sitting in the tent and wondering if you should just head outside, you hear hooves clopping outside. You huddle to a corner and stay there, hoping it's not an animal that could eat you. But the clopping stops, and you see a shadow on the outside of the tent. The shadow keeps shifting, and suddenly, the tent's flap door opens.

Standing in the doorway is a young girl, with tan skin and long black hair done in an intricate braid. She wears loose, bright-colored clothing with many tassels hanging from it. Her deep black eyes scan the tent, before inevitably resting on you.

You just sit there, staring at her, and wave meekly. You're about to ask of she can help when she suddenly pounces, clasping her hands around your tiny body. You squirm, but it's useless as she lifts you up, a smile on her face.

"The legends were true," she whispers.

You just stare at the young girl, shocked more by the speed and dexterity she just displayed than her size.

"Um... What legend?" you ask, your voice quivering in fear.

The girl simply keeps smiling, and steps out of the tent. You see that there's a moose there, apparently male judging by the antlers, and he's wearing a makeshift saddle. The girl stops next to the moose, who seems to ignore you, and she talks again.

"Legends from my village say that there are evil red crystals that can shrink people and make them weak," she continued, her voice quiet. "It seems you found one of them... But I can help you."

You dangle there, her hands firmly squeezing your body from shoulder to knee, and just look inquisitively up at her giant face.

"Yes, I think I can help you," she says. "But I'll need to do something first...."
15322112.title: A girl and her moose

153221121.content:
"What?!" you replied in shock. "But why?"

"Because I really need to be sure that legend says is true." she replies you. "Because the red crystal doesn't affect me or neither people from my village, so I want to see if it really work..."

Now, you're not really sure if you can trust that mysterious young girl who seen to be at age of ten years old. Of course, maybe she cans help you, you're at 6 inches but you don't know how small you'll get this time. But you have admire that you have no choice but accepted her requires.

"O-okay..." you say with unsure as the young girl smiles and take out a red crystal that she mentioned, still holding you with her other hand, she brings the crystal close to you will you pray to not getting too small.

"Alright, here we go!" she gently touches you with the crystal and you rapidly shrink in her hand, which you sinking in her grid but she feels you inside of her fist. The girl turns her position hand to horizontal and open her palm.

The girl's eyes wided as she found you become even smaller before. You were at 6 inches then now you are at...
153221121.title: "I need to shrink you more."

153222.content:
You certainly are a tough one to please, aren't you? You know, I can only do so much as to the delivery of shrunken people getting eaten by animal stories for your enjoyment. All I can tell you is that you either pick from the sizes listed, or you move on to another story.

I'm not trying to turn you away, don't get me wrong. There's plenty of content to be enjoyed, and many an adventure to be had. There are over 100 other chapters of excitement, action, suspense, and gullets. Everyone loves gullets. I know you do too (if you've read this far, I can only assume that much), and there's plenty of them to be had here. If you're really that oppressed about not being able to choose a specific size that's tailored to your personal tastes or preferences, then I suggest you get to work on your own story. Hey, maybe if it's good enough, I'll add on to it. Still want to read this? Then go back and pick a size.
153222.title: Custom Sizing! ...not.

choices: Pet Store (just about anything you can think of)
154.title: next

1541.content: You wander into the pet store and find...
1541.title: Pet store?

15411.content:
A dinosaur aisle? How is that even possible?! You walk down the isle and you're shocked to see that there really were live dinosaurs in the aisle! There was a key difference, however; all of these dinosaurs were the size of regular housepets! As you look around, you see a T-Rex that wasn't even as tall as your knees, a pterodactyl the size of an ordinary bird, and a triceratops the size of a common chameleon! You were really interested now!

Suddenly, you feel a pounding headache and you pass out. When you come to, you realize that you've been shrunken and placed into the _______ cage!
15411.title: Dinosaur section

choices: You are too scared to run!
154111.content:
The pounding headache is gone and you start to look around agitated. You're surrounded by several trees and some bushes and recognize this place. It's the T-Rex cage! How did you end up there?
Suddenly, you hear some footsteps. You panic and start to run through the lush vegetation. The footsteps are getting closer as you reach a flat desert area with some little mountains at the end. And you can see the cage bars next to it too! When you're reaching the mountain, a huge roar come out of the jungle and the T-Rex appears. You are so nervous about your possible flight that you trip over a hole and go tumbling along the ground. You hit against the stone of the cage side. As you try get up dazed, you look around to see that you can get to the bars if you're fast enough. At the time you realize this, there is only a short distance between you and the huge reptile. You...
154111.title: T-Rex

1541111.content: Being in front of an really alive dinosaur is probably a cool thing. But not in a situation where it is a T-rex and you are going to be considered as food. Hearing the loud footsteps that the dinosaur made, you became too scared to run away and just stood still. The next thing you know is seeing a huge jaw of the reptile infront of you. It's now trying to...
1541111.title: Too scared to run!

choices: You are immune to the acid!
15411111.content: You fell on the ground before the gigantic mouth. You tried to stand up and get away, but it's no use. The whole mouth came upon you and have you covered in the darkness. 15421221221112211121111.content:
The fall from the majestic lion's tail had been short, but certainly not sweet. Still, for two things, you could be thankful. First, the impact your small form made against the lion's tailhole was too imperceptible to rouse the powerful beast from his slumber. Had he gotten up now, surely you would have fallen to a certain and unceremonious death. And second, the tight, foul-smelling ring proved a soft landing, if nothing else.

That being said, as you lay there face-down against the male feline's warm anus, you found it quite hard to count your blessings. Your reverence towards the sleeping creature lessened somewhat with each tainted breath you took. The air still reeked from his earlier gassy release, and unfortunately, you were inhaling it right from the source. You knew you couldn't remain here--it was only a matter of time before the lazy lion's power nap came to an end. But try as you might, you couldn't break loose: your body was fixed in place, stuck to the beast's tailhole. If you could just move, just budge a little bit, you could slowly climb your way down and to the ground below. You wouldn't run, of course. This snoozing king of the jungle was your only source of security at present. But at the very least, you could relocate yourself in front of his maw, maybe wait for him to wake up...

Your thoughts were interrupted by a sudden pulsing of the lion's anal ring. You felt your heart sink at once, and you dreaded taking another vile fart here, point blank. With what little energy you could muster, you began squirming once more, futile though it seemed. However, fate was not on your side. Rather than expelling anything, the powerful ring instead seemed intent on claiming your little form within! Your small protestations and wriggles had only served to stimulate the lion's tailhole, and before long, you felt the squishy, wrinkled surface beneath you jut outward, then spread itself open. In you went, head-first, though you fought as hard as you could to escape. Your hands gripped at either side of the ring's entrance, but to no avail. In short time, the powerful anus quivered and pulled you fully within, sealing tightly behind your feet.

This was not the end of your journey. The muscular walls of the dark tunnel continued to pull you inward, deeper into the beast's rear end. Though you'd entered screaming, you quickly appreciated the value of the outside air in your lungs, and tried your best not to waste it. Eventually, however, your breath ran short, and you had no choice but to sate your lungs with the awful, humid air around you. God, it was horrible! You hoped desperately to escape, but the squishy constricting walls kept you held firmly in place. Your best efforts did have some effect: after squirming wildly, you seemed to have stimulated the foul-smelling cavern. For your hard work, you were rewarded with a hellish, putrid lion fart right in your face, followed by a low and very satisfied-sounding purr from the sleeping creature.

What little you'd been exposed to outside had scarcely prepared you for this unbelievable torture. The rank gas wafted all around your little form, and you choked on the unbearable scent of the slumbering beast's release. You hoped desperately that somehow, some way, you'd escape. Perhaps you'd wake up, and find this was all a bad dream. But as moments passed, the possibility seemed extremely remote. Struggling for breath, you came to accept the very real and very precarious situation you were in. Mercifully, the noxious gas finally went to your head, and you fell unconscious.

-----

Hours later, you woke up in total darkness. A quick whiff of the foul air around you immediately revealed your location. You were exactly where you had been, still stranded in the feline's rear. But now, the tunnel around you appeared to be moving. It seemed the lion was now awake, and wandering about the plain, clearly unaffected by the apparent loss of his newfound pet. You wondered how long you'd been out, and how much longer you would remain here. But experience had taught you not to squirm.

Regardless, though you remained perfectly still, the world around you began to rumble forcibly, and your heart raced. Not again, you thought. As you braced yourself for the absolute worst, you smelled something horrid further ahead in the darkness. The walls around you pulsed and throbbed, apparently pulling the source towards you. It didn't take much for you to figure out what was happening: the lion was about to relieve itself, and you were directly in the path of its waste! Your previous reservations about squirming seemed to melt away as you jerked and wriggled violently, but you remained stuck in place. The scent grew fouler and fouler still, until at last, a wall of soft, mushy nastiness pressed against you. Struggling not to vomit, you hoped desperately that, if nothing else, this would prove enough to push you out and into the light of day once more.

For one thing, despite finally managing to unstick yourself from his anal walls over a month ago, you had opted to remain within his rear end. Furthermore, you never had to worry yourself about finding something to sustain yourself on. The feline's leftovers kept you alive, and by now, you had lost all sense of revulsion towards the arrangement. There was simply no reason to leave: you had everything you needed.

And so it was that for the rest of your life, you remained willingly sealed inside the magnificent lion's rear end. As the years passed, you came to view the majestic beast as a sort of god.
